question: Can Characters join Swarms?
author: Andreas Schmidt
referenced_rules:
Characters Joining Skirmishers CRB 185
Characters & Units CRB 207
Unbreakable CRB 179
Loner CRB 172
content: Yes, if they are not prevented from joining them by special rules (Unbreakable, Loner, Fly, Ethereal) or different troop type and skirmish formation.

question: "Are modifiers to charge rolls part of the charge roll for the purpose of re-rolling?
author: Andreas Schmidt
referenced_rules:
Swifstride CRB 178
GW FAQ
Waaagh Banner, Crusader's Zeal, First to the Fray, Daemon of Slaanesh, 'Ere We Go!, Virtue of the Impetuous Knight, Beast Banner
content:
The modifiers are not part of the charge roll and abilities that let you reroll the charge roll cannot be applied for modifiers.

However, as a failed charge references the charge roll, it uses the result of the charge roll with modifiers, not precising "without modifiers" for the determination of the failed charge move.

question: Does a frenzied unit need to declare a charge if there is a friendly unit in it's way, if the friendly unit could itself declare a charge and move out of the way?
turn_order: 2-1 Movement Phase Declare Charges and Charge Reaction
author: Andreas Schmidt
content: No, the frenzied unit only has to declare a charge if the blocking unit is declaring a charge but the blocking unit is not obliged to do so

question: How exactly does charging of skirmishers work with formed units. Text and diagram seems to contradict each other.
author: Andreas Schmidt
referenced_rules:
Formed Units Charging Skirmishers CRB 186
Directly Towards CRB 92
content: When a formed unit of any type (be it Close Order, Open Order and so on) charges a unit of Skirmishers, it must endeavour to move as directly as possible into contact with the closestvisible model in the target unit. As usual, the charging unit may wheel once, at any point, during its move). This means you wheel the minimal distance needed to have contact with the closest visible model of the skirmishing unit and then charge forward in as straight a line as possible until you make contact. Upon contact, the skirmishing unit forms up as described in the skirmisher rules. To avoid abusive situations this should only apply if there is sufficient movement left. First priority is to complete the charge by get in contact with an enemy model. The skirmisher should align to the unit once contact is made rather than the unit having to manoeuvre to the facing of the skirmisher

question: Do Excess Wounds from Multiple Wounds (X) count for Overkill vs. non-Character models (Champions)?
author: Andreas Schmidt
referenced_rules:
Hits that Inflict Multiple Wounds CRB 143
Multiple Wounds (X) CRB 175
Overkill and Champions GW FAQ 1.5.1 11
Overkill CRB 211
content: Yes. All Challenges, both vs. Characters and Champions allow Overkill, so excess wounds from multiple wounds should be counted against Champions as well. Champions are treated as Characters for this Purpose.

question: What happens when only characters (excluding champions) are left in a unit?
author: Andreas Schmidt
content: The unit immediately ceases to exist. Treat the characters as units on their own and use the lone character rules if applicable. In combat, any attacks on lower initiative steps may be allocated to those characters according to the rules for multiple units in combat. Out of combat, the surviving characters and nearby units must make Panic for "nearby friend destroyed" if the US of the destroyed unit was high enough (including the surviving characters). Surviving characters who fail their Panic will Fall Back in Good Order. Any special rules of the unit cease to exist (characters still have their own special rules). If a spell was only on the unit (not being cast by self range by one of the characters), the characters lose the effect of that spell.

question: Does a Slayer of Legend apply it's \"Slayer of…\" rules to hits caused by deathblow?
author: Andreas Schmidt
content: Yes

question: Can a model that is only in base contact with a champion or a character allocate attacks to the unit itself or does it have to allocate all attacks to the champion or character?
turn_order: 4-1 Combat Phase Choose Combat & Determine Who Can Fight
author: Andreas Schmidt
referenced_rules: Choose Combat & Determine Who Can Fight CRB 145 - 146Multiple Units in Combat CRB 147Characters in Combat 209
content: Yes, the rules which force units to allocate attacks are only relevant for multiple units, but characters and the unit forme one single unit, you can allocate attacks to the unit.

question: Can a model that would have been able to make a supporting attack but that stepped forward to the fighting rank this round still attack (i.e. if there are no other models to step up)?
turn_order: 4-1 Combat Phase Choose Combat & Determine Who Can Fight
author: Andreas Schmidt
referenced_rules: Stepping Forward CRB 102Supporting Attacks CRB 145Excess Casualties CRB 150
content: Yes, the GW FAQ states that a model can make supporting attacks when the model in front is killed. This should mean the supporting attacks can be performend even if it stepped up.

question: Can a character that falls back in good order use evade?
author: Andreas Schmidt
content: No, the Pursuit Move is still part of the combat. Until the end of Step 4 both units count as being engaged in combat for this purpose.

question: Can you use the hatred from rolling a 2 on the Darkforged weapon to re-roll hits with the Blood of Hashut?
author: Andreas Schmidt
content: Yes, the hatred effect would apply to any attacks the bearer made- as it effects the model not modifies the weapon.

question: Does a champion in a unit with a single Rank open a new rank when refusing a challenge.
turn_order: 4-1 Combat Phase Choose Combat & Determine Who Can Fight
author: Andreas Schmidt
referenced_rules: Refusing a Challenge 210Nowhere to Run CRB 211
content: No, since you are only allowed to Redress the Ranks during a reform, Nowhere to Run applies and the challenge may not be refused.

question: If there are multiple selections for the restriction „0-1 unit may…“. Can multiple units take one of the selections each, or can only one single unit have one or more of these selections?
author: Andreas Schmidt
content: Multiple units can have one or more of these selections, but no selection can be taken more than once in this case.

question: Are victory points cumulative if a unit flees and is below 25% of its starting size?
author: Andreas Schmidt
content: You take the maximum of points, in this case 50% for a fleeing unit

question: Phantasmagoria Spell - Does it count for out of movement phase movements? Does it trigger if you don't move?
author: Andreas Schmidt
content: It will trigger for any movement (in or out of phase) that ends within range - but it will not trigger if you choose not to move.

question: Is a handmaiden of the Lady able to cast assailment spells from the back rank using the Shield of the Lady special rule?
author: Andreas Schmidt
content: Yes, she can cast spells as being in the fighting rank

question: How do Items interact that let you throw an additional dice and discard the lowest and items that enforce you to roll an additional dice and discard the highest? Do they cancel themselves out so you just roll 2 dice or do they make you roll 4 dice discarding highest and lowest (making double 1s even more likely)
author: Andreas Schmidt
content: You would roll 4 dice

question: Can a unit using the Fly(X) special rule pass freely without penalty above areas \"treated as\" or \"counting as\" difficult, dangerous or impassable terrain due to the effect of a spell (in particular Magical Vortex)?
author: Andreas Schmidt
content: No. Fly(X) allows the unit to move over physical terrain features without penalty, but Magical Vortexes and areas affected by a spell are not terrain features. "Magical Vortexes are considered tall enough to affect even models flying high above the battlefield", so units that Fly through them or their area of effect are affected as any other unit (e.g. -1 to movement, low dice if charging, dangerous terrain tests, blocked by impassable, damage from vortexes).

question: Can the Bound Spell \"Storm Call\" be used after a successful charge? The Spell is a Magic Missile that can be explicitely be cast in combat, while the rule for shooting says that you cannot shoot when engaged in combat or after a charge.
author: Andreas Schmidt
referenced_rules: Beastmen BrayherdsDragon Ogre ShaggothStorm Call RH 104Who can Shoot CRB 137
content: You can use it after a successful charge. RAI, the allowance to cast it into combat should also mean you can use it after a successful charge.

question: Do Universal Special Rules apply also to Magic Missiles and Vortexes
author: Andreas Schmidt
referenced_rules: Armour Bane Magic Missiles GW FAQ 1.5.1 11
content: No, Magic Missiles and Vortexes cannot benefit from the casters special rules unless specifically stated otherwise

question: If a unit is returning after pursuing off the battlefield, does it need to be placed more than 8\" away from enemy units as per ambushers rules.
author: Andreas Schmidt
referenced_rules: Pursuit off the Battlefield CRB 157Ambushers CRB 166
content: No, this is restriction is when the position is chosen. The position for returning is as close as possible to the point at which it left the battlefield in a legal position (e.g. 1" away from enemy units and not on top of own units

question: Does warpstone token trigger only on a D6 roll of a natural one. Or does it trigger on a 1,2 on the D6.
author: Andreas Schmidt
content: A Natural roll of 1 on a D3 is a 1 or 2 on a D6

question: How is the distance of a wheel measured?
author: Andreas Schmidt
content: It is measured by taking a straight line from the outside front corner of the starting position to the outside front corner of the end position of the outermost model. For wheels that move over an angle greather than 90 degrees, measure the wheel in increments of (up to) 90 degrees.

question: How is he rear corner defined that is allowed to move through units (from the previous FAQs)
author: Andreas Schmidt
referenced_rules: Wheel through another unit GW FAQ 1.5.1 9
content: If there is no alternative a unit can move through other units as long as the front edge is not touching the other unit.

question: Does the move of the counter-charge count as a charge move, for example for the purpose of furious charge?
turn_order: 2-1 Movement Phase Declare Charges and Charge Reaction
author: Andreas Schmidt
referenced_rules: Charge Move CRB 121Counter Charge CRB 167Furious Charge CRB 171Impact Hits CRB 172
content: Yes, since GW states in the FAQ that a counter-charge is, in fact, a charge

question: Can a Model with the special rule Random Movement use Fly (X) to move over units?
author: Andreas Schmidt
content: No, Random Movement is not based on the movement characteristic, hence the unit cannot use the special rule Fly(X). Random Movement Units move in the compulsory movement phase and therefore neither march, charge or manoeuvre.

question: When you make a Redress the Ranks manoeuvre, do you need to remove/add the models as equal as possible or can you choose (e.g. adding 5 models to only one side)
author: Andreas Schmidt
referenced_rules: Manoeuvres Redress the Ranks CRB 125Drilled CRB 167
content: You need to add/remove models as evenly as possible to keep command group in the middle

question: How do you perform a turn, with non square bases, e.g. Cavalry as the Models would overlap.
author: Andreas Schmidt
content: Turn the center model to keep the unit center the same and then align all other models accordingly so that the number of previous ranks are the current files and vice versa (given they have enough movement to conduct this maneuver)

question: If a unit with evasive moves out of range or out of LOS with their reactionary move, what happens?
author: Andreas Schmidt
content: The attacks are still declared and are unable to be made

question: If a cannon can see a large target over other models, can it choose a target point that it cannot see due to the presence of intervening models?
author: Andreas Schmidt
content: No, a cannon must have LoS to its target point. It could target the edge of the large target's base, but intervening models block LoS to points on the ground. If the cannon is on a hill or is a large target itself, then it can see over intervening models accordingly.

question: Does Hawk Eyed Archer effect melee and ranged attacks?
author: Andreas Schmidt
referenced_rules: Wood Elves Hawk Eyed Archer FoF 123
content: Only Ranged

question: Does hawk-eyed archer allow you to target war machine crew?
author: Andreas Schmidt
referenced_rules: Wood Elves Hawk Eyed Archer FoF 123
content: No, as the war machine and crew are actually 1 model, with split stats based on the type of attack. You will always make these attacks vs the war machine profile when doing ranged attacks

question: What is a shooting attack? Are spells also considered shooting?
author: Andreas Schmidt
referenced_rules: The Shooting Phase CRB 136How Many Shots? CRB 137Look Out Sir CRB 199Look Out, Sir CRB 209Wailing Dirge
content: All attacks that are performed in the shooting phase are considered shooting attacks, including spells

question: Can a character with Hawk-eyed archer or a similar ability target a Skaven Weapon team. The rule says that he can only target characters
author: Andreas Schmidt
referenced_rules: Wood Elves Hawk Eyed Archer FoF 123Targeting Weapon Teams Skaven 8Targeting Lone characters CRB 206
content: Yes, the rules are written for the core factions where no other models than characters can benefit from Lone Character. Therefore it would also work against models that are no characters but have the same mechanic

question: Does the entire unit count as moved when determining the shooting penalty, or is it determined by individual models?
author: Andreas Schmidt
referenced_rules: Movement & Manoeuvre CRB 185Moving and Shooting CRB 139
content: It is determined by individual models. Note that marching applies to the entire unit, except for a character who joined a unit that marched but did not march himself.

question: How do you remove models \"as equally as possible\", for example from shooting against Motley Crew Units
turn_order: 3-4 Shooting Phase Remove Casualties & Make Panic Tests
author: Andreas Schmidt
content: You can determine one model after the other by dividing the number of remaining models in each group by the number of models in that group removed already plus 1. The higher number will be the group of models where one model needs to be removed. In case of tie the attacker decides. So if you have 8 Models Group A and 2 Models Group B you would remove: A A (A or B) (B or A) A A (A or B) (B or A) A A

question: Does a unit need to be fully withn 12\" to be save from a Stone Thrower Shot or is partially within sufficient as you always determine thecloses distance for range.
author: Andreas Schmidt
content: As soon as the closest part is within 12" the unit can't be shot

question: Can the Doomwheel use its Zzzap! rule while engaged and fleeing?
author: Andreas Schmidt
content: Yes, there are no restrictions. The lightning is independent from its ability to perform shooting attacks.

question: Can the rules Shield of the Lady and Verminous Valour, which both allow a character to ‘retire’ by ‘moving through the ranks’, be used outside of combat? These rules specify they can be used 'at any time', but also directly refer to 'the fighting rank' and 'the combat', and the rule for 'moving through the ranks’
author: Andreas Schmidt
referenced_rules: Skaven Verminous ValourBretonnia Shield of the Lady
content: No, these rules directly refer to 'the fighting rank' and 'the combat' which only apply in combat, and involve 'moving through the ranks' which requires the unit to be engaged and the character to return to its original position as soon as it disengages. Note that you cannot use it as a reaction on already stated or announced actions. This means while resolving a combat you have to use it at the end of an initiative step, before targets of models' attacks are announced. You can use it outside of resolving the combat at any time, given the unit is engaged in combat.

question: Is the bonus from My Will be done applied before or after strikes last?
author: Andreas Schmidt
referenced_rules: Tomb Kings My Will Be done RH 126
content: You set the initiative to 1, and then apply modifiers, so you would add MWBD after.

question: Can I stack Casket of Souls Covenant of Power?
author: Andreas Schmidt
referenced_rules: Tomb Kings Casket of Souls RH 148
content: No. The rule grants the bonus if you are with a casket. If there is 1 or multiple Caskets doesn't matter

question: Is there a difference between rules that say you suffer a wound and ones that say you lose a wound?
author: Andreas Schmidt
content: Suffering a wound allows armor and ward saves if not specifically ruled otherwise. Losing a wound means the model loses the wound with only Regeneration saves allowed (if not ruled out by any special rules).

question: When does a unit test when suffering Heavy Casualties.
turn_order: 3-4 Shooting Phase Remove Casualties & Make Panic Tests
author: Andreas Schmidt
referenced_rules: Psychology of War Heavy Casualties CRB 161
content: Immediately after the attacks that caused the losses are performed the unit need to test. Could lead to situations where a unit also FBIGO despite losing additional losses afterwards that would make them to be < 50% and flee

question: When a Unit Gives Ground, do you move them in a straight line or center to center away from the enemy unit
author: Andreas Schmidt
referenced_rules: Directly towards, directly away CRB 92Give Ground CRB 134
content: The rule says directly away but no pivots or turns. This means you move center to center but keep the facing.

question: How do multiple instances of Multiple Wounds special rule stack, e.g. Multiple Wounds (D3) and Multiple Wounds (2)?
author: Andreas Schmidt
content: It would be D3 +1 as MW (2) is effectively Wounds (+1)

question: Against which enemies exactly do Hatred (X) and Fear (X) work against ? For instance Hatred (Orcs & Goblins), Fear (Elves) or Hatred (Wizards) ?
author: Andreas Schmidt
content: Only against models which are X. For instance, Hatred (Orcs & Goblins) does not reference the faction name "Orc & Goblin Tribes", it only references models which contain an orc and/or a goblin (including Chaos Dwarfs' Black Orcs). Models with Fear (Elves) fear models which contain an elf. Models with Hatred (Wizards) hate all models containing a wizard.

question: Do characters and crew on mounts benefit from the special rules- such as poisoned for Arachnarok, Flaming for Flamespire Phoenix, or Magical for Demonic Mount
author: Andreas Schmidt
content: Yes, Unless noted otherwise, any special rules that apply to one element (chariot, character, crew or beasts) apply to the others as well. Effects are shared- both positive and negative.

question: Does a character on Lammasu get Armor Bane (2)
author: Andreas Schmidt
content: Yes

question: How many wounds are counted for Combat Result/Overkill when models are killed with Killing Blow
author: Andreas Schmidt
referenced_rules: Multiple Wound Models CRB 102Killing Blow CRB 172Killing Blow GW FAQ 1.5.1 7
content: Each attack that inflicts Killing Blow or similar ability inflicts a number of wounds equal to the remaining wounds of the model. Excess wounds with Killing Blow count in challenges as one single wound.

question: Does a Unit that fails a Fear test before charging makes a Failed Charge Move.
turn_order: 2-1 Movement Phase Declare Charges and Charge Reaction
author: Andreas Schmidt
content: No, the Unit counts as having made a failed charge but doesn't actually move.

question: The rule say that Magic Resistance doesn't stack. Does this count only for multiple models or does it include single models?
author: Andreas Schmidt
content: Magic Resistance from various sources or multiple items doesn't stack for single models unless it is explicitly stated (like Obsidian Lodestone stacks with itself)

question: Do the modifiers for several Mortis Engine stack? How often do you roll on the Miscast table when you are in the Commanding Range of 2 Mortis Engines?
author: Andreas Schmidt
referenced_rules: Vampire Counts Mortis Engine 17Accursed ReliquaryBlasphemous Tome
content: Given that the rules say you get the bonus if you are in range of "this model" the modifiers do stack for several Mortis Engines. In case ogf a Miscast an absolute number of rolls is given. So you roll twice no matter how many Mortis Engines are in range.

question: How does the 'Resurrecting the Fallen' ability work with units in Skirmish formation?
author: Andreas Schmidt
referenced_rules: Vampire Counts Invocation of Nehek 5Tomb Kings Arise! RH 128Resurrecting the Fallen RH 154Resurrecting the Fallen Vampire Counts 28
content: You can use the rule and resurrect models, but only place them in coherency of models that were present at the start of the phase.

question: Does the controlling player choose the direction before or after rolling the distance for a spell, effect, or model (such as a fanatic) that moves in a random distance?
author: Andreas Schmidt
content: Choose before rolling. RAW is ambiguous, and the functional difference is minimal. This is less a "correct" answer and more of having something in place to keep the game flowing.

question: Some abilities grant bonuses to a characteristic, up to a maximum value. Some grant bonuses with no mention of a maximum value. When used together, how do they interact?
author: Andreas Schmidt
content: Any limitation is applied at the end of characteristic calculation. If there are no limitations on the characteristic from any source, you can go above 10.

question: When is the Unit Strength for \"Nearby Friend Flees Combat\" (Unit Strength > 5) measured?
author: Andreas Schmidt
referenced_rules: Nearby Friend Flees Combat CRB 161CRB 151-156GW FAQ 1.5.1 11
content: Like 'Nearby Friend destroyed', the Unit Strength for Nearby Friend Flees combat is tracked at the beginning of the combat phase, as the FAQ states you 'should keep track of Unit Strength during each phase.'

question: Can a Steam Tank fire both its missile weapons (Steam cannon and Steam gun) in a single shooting phase?
author: Andreas Schmidt
referenced_rules: Empire Steam Tank FoF 68Who can shoot CRB 137Missile Weapons CRB 216FAQ 2024-04-09
content: No, the crew can fire either the Steam cannon or the Steam gun.

question: Some weapons shoot like a war machine, such as the Cygor's Hurl attack and the Steam Tank's Steam Cannon. Both state, \"If a 'Misfire' is rolled on the Artillery dice, this model loses a single Wound (instead of rolling on a Misfire table).\" If a Misfire is rolled, is the attack still successful?
author: Andreas Schmidt
referenced_rules: Empire Steam Tank Steam Cannon FF 69Beastmen Brayherds Cybor Hurl Attack RH 107
content: No. Not explicitly RAW. However, a Misfire result does not provide a numeric value that you need to carry out the attack. All results on a Misfire table result in the attack failing, and this seems like a reasonable extrapolation.

question: What is the exact sequence of the Terror leadership test and the associated flee move if the test is failed?
turn_order: 2-1 Movement Phase Declare Charges and Charge Reaction
author: Andreas Schmidt
content: The leadership test is done as soon as the unit causing terror has declared a charge, even before finishing to declare all other charges. The flee move is performed with the other charge reactions, after all charges have been declared.

question: Can Units adopt Special Rules or Formations that would prevent characters from joining them, while joined by such a character? (for example: grail pilgrims becoming unbreakable while joined by a non-unbreakable character or units in open order reforming to skirmishers while joined by a character of a different sub-type or troop type).
author: Andreas Schmidt
content: The character must first leave the unit, before the unit may adapt skirmish formation. If the character already joined the unit prior to the special rule coming into effect, the whole unit including the character gets to use the special rule.

question: Is a handmaiden of the Lady able to cast Magic Missile spells from the back rank using the Shield of the Lady special rule, because other models are blocking its Line of Sight ?
author: Andreas Schmidt
content: Yes, "units do not block the character's line of sight", so its perfectly possible to cast magic missiles.

question: Is nudging units (because of rules like the 1\" move and the shrinking units rules during combat) considered when determining whether a unit has moved ? For instance for Dangerous Terrain, Drilled and Lumbering rules, or the malus to shoot if the unit has moved ?
author: Andreas Schmidt
content: No

question: When do you place your additional wood from \"Woodland Ambush\" rule.
author: Andreas Schmidt
content: After deciding the sides, but before deploying any unit.

question: Do you need to maximize the number of models in combat or take the shortest route if that means that the unit charges two units or has the rule that you only charge one unit takes precedence over maximising.
author: Andreas Schmidt
referenced_rules: The Charge Move CRB 126Multiple Charge Targets CRB 130
content: If you can avoid charging two units you have to do so, event if that means you cannot maximise or take a longer route. Please note that completing the charge has priority. So you would charge two units if that is the only way to charge successfully.

question: What are exactly the conditions to meet to buy a magic armour on a character?
author: Andreas Schmidt
content: To buy a magical shield, your character must be (or has the option to be) equipped with a shield. To buy a magical suit of armour, your character must be (or has the option to be) equipped with any suit of armour (light/heavy/plate), natural armour (such as calloused hide) excluded. To buy any other magical armour that is not an suit of armour or a shield, your character must be (or has the option to be) equipped with either a shield or any armour, natural armour excluded.I.E. a skink priest cannot be given any kind of magical armour even if it has calloused hide

question: Arcane Familiar: when has the owner to decide how many spells he rolls on a lore or another?
author: Andreas Schmidt
content: When random generating your spell with arcane familiar declare how many spell you want to generate on each lore. Reroll duplicate spell for each lore. If you want you can replace a single spell from only one lore with the signature spell of the same lore or with a spell from the army lore the wizard may have

question: How do you reform a unit from Skirmish Formation to Close or Open Order?
author: Andreas Schmidt
content: If you reform from skirmishing formation, maintain the centre of the unit as good as possible and rank all models up around that point. You may freely chose the facing of the unit. Place command group models accordingly. Every model may move up to twice its movement characteristic as stated under maneuvers. Remove any skirmishers as casualties that are not able to rank up.

question: What happens if a model has a initiative value of 0 or below (for example via multiple mantle of stone; Chaos Dwarf magic item)?
author: Andreas Schmidt
content: Characteristics cannot go below 0. Models with Initiative 0 attack in Initiative order, after all attacks with initiative 1, including stomp attacks.

question: Can a model with the Grail Vow benefit from it's Ward save when facing another Bretonnian Army?
author: Andreas Schmidt
referenced_rules:
Bretonnia Blessings of the Lady FOF 107
Bretonnia Grail Vow FOF 108
content: Yes, the army cannot pray to receive the Blessing. Models with the Grail Vow already have the Blessing before the Battle.

question: What is considered the front and rear corner of a unit in Lance Formation for the purpose of determining if it can pass through other units?
author: Andreas Schmidt
content: For this purpose, the front edge of the second rank and the model in the first rank cannot pass through units. The rest of the unit can wheel through other units as the models would take a direct route as described in the GW FAQ.

question: Who can allocate attacks to a single model in a Lance Formation?
turn_order: 4-1 Combat Phase Choose Combat & Determine Who Can Fight
author: Andreas Schmidt
content: All models in both fighting ranks can allocate attacks to a single model in the enemies fighting rank. This also means that every model in each fighting rank can do all it's attacks, even it is not physically in base contact with either unit.

question: A unit with random movement arrives as reinforcements or with the ambushers special rule during the compulsory moves sub-phase. Can this unit move during this sub-phase ?
author: Andreas Schmidt
referenced_rules:
Reinforcements CRB 134
Accidental Contact CRB 131
Pursuit off the Battlefield CRB 157
Random Movement CRB 176
content: Yes, it did not move yet using its random movement rule. Please note that if the model is able to make contact with an enemy unit it may do so and counts as having charged.

question: When do you need to decide or declare if a unit is scouting?
author: Andreas Schmidt
content: You don't need to declare it in advance. Units with the Scout ability can be deployed at any point during the regular deployment phase, up until characters are deployed.

question: The Veteran rule grants a reroll for Leadership Tests. Can you also reroll tests made 'against the unit's Leadership characteristic' (e.g. Panic Tests)?
author: Andreas Schmidt
content: Yes

question: Is a character that joins another unit still considered a unit for any rules purpose? What about special rules that unit has, but the character hasn't or vice versa?
author: Andreas Schmidt
content: They form together a single unit. Whenever the word 'unit' is mentioned in a special rule the unit already has or when the rule comes from a magical banner in that unit, apply rules for both the character and the unit he joined. Special Rules a character has only apply to the unit if "and any unit they have joined" is mentioned or similar.Please note that some special rules could cease to apply if a character without a special rule joins a unit or vice versa (e.g. Counter Charge).Special rules that affect models or weapons do NOT translate from one model to the whole unit or vice versa (a unit with poisoned attacks will not give the character poisoned attacks when joining).Special rules that only need the majority of models to have the special rule will work (e.g. Reserve Move).If a character that casted a spell or used an ability "that affects the caster and any unit he has joined" leaves a unit after casting that spell/using the ability, only the caster has the effect, but if he joins another unit, that unit will benefit from that effect too.if a character in a unit becomes the target of the effects ethereal, fly or any other rule that would prevent them from joining, the character can still be part of the unit, but once they leave it, they are not allowed to join again as long as the character has these special rules.if a unit with a character becomes the target of a spell that grants them a Special Rule or Ability, the character can benefit from it while it has joined the unit even if the Special Rule or Ability would prevent them from joining, but will lose it the moment it leaves the unit. If all the models of the unit are removed as casualties, the unit ceases to exist immediately, and the character loses the Special Rule or Ability.Anyway, if a character moved or marched before joining a unit, the unit will not count as moved/marched and vice versa.

question: If the single-use effect of a magic weapon, such as Wollopa’s One Hit Wunda, has not been used or has already been expended, can the wielder choose to use a different mundane weapon instead during combat?
author: Andreas Schmidt
referenced_rules:
Single use magic items CRB 337
Wollopas One Hit wunda RH 43
content: No, Wollopa’s One Hit Wunda continues to count as a magical hand weapon even after its single-use effect is expended. Since it remains a magic item, you are not permitted to switch to another mundane weapon in that combat. Remember, general rules for switching weapons between rounds of combat still apply.

question: What happens when you charge a unit in the rear with an incomplete rank and kill all models in that rank? Do the models in the \"new\" rank can attack since they did not step forward nor were killed?
turn_order: 4-1 Combat Phase Choose Combat & Determine Who Can Fight
author: Andreas Schmidt
referenced_rules: Choose Combat & Determine Who can fight CRB 145ff
content: No, only those models can attack in their initiative step that were projected into the fighting rank before and weren't killed during prior attacks. To make it easier, you can determine the fighting rank for rear charges at the beginning of the combat, after characters have moved and challenges have been called.

question: Can a mounted Character on light chariot (that has to adapt open order formation from its mount) joins a unit that has adopted close order formation?
author: Andreas Schmidt
content: Yes, the rule for mounted character formation ceases to apply as soon as he joins the unit and ceases to be an independent unit - the character will adopt the units formation.

question: Is it possible for a unit with the Chariot troop type to charge through a unit in Skirmish formation that is in close combat with the Chariot Runners special rule and simply nudge the skirmisher models aside?
author: Andreas Schmidt
content: No. Skirmishers in combat take 'Close formation', (see page 185) and are no longer in the lose arrangement of models that a unit in Skirmish formation adopts when not in combat.

question: Do other special rules also applies to units that are not yet on the battlefield (or that have left the battlefield for a turn) ? For instance, do they have to roll for Stupidity at the Start of turn sub-phase ? Can they roll for Gaze of the Gods at the Command sub-phase?
author: Andreas Schmidt
content: Units don't count as long as they are not on the battlefield, they don't get to use their special rules.

question: Can models acting on the same Initiative step, rolled one after another, decide to react to changes in the positions of characters, or decide one by one whether to strike at a character or the unit?
turn_order: 4-1 Combat Phase Choose Combat & Determine Who Can Fight
author: Andreas Schmidt
content: No, all attacks at the same Initiative step are considered to happen simultaneously. Therefore, changes in the positions of characters, such as a handmaiden retiring after striking, do not affect the resolution of other attacks on that Initiative step. Models attacking on the same Initiative step can still target the character as if she were in her original position.

question: Can a character that retired from the fighting rank due to too many models return to the fighting rank because of follow-up moves or a shrinking unit?
turn_order: 4-1 Combat Phase Choose Combat & Determine Who Can Fight
author: Andreas Schmidt
content: Yes, if the fighting rank shrinks or follow-up moves create space, a character that previously retired can return to the fighting rank, provided they meet the positioning requirements outlined in the rules.

question: Can a character that retired from a challenge return to the fighting rank because of follow-up moves or a shrinking unit?
turn_order: 4-1 Combat Phase Choose Combat & Determine Who Can Fight
author: Andreas Schmidt
content: Yes, but only if maintaining the unit's formation requires the character to step forward into the fighting rank due to casualties or shrinking ranks. This applies when the only available position to preserve the unit's structure is in the fighting rank.

question: What happens when a unit falls below Unit Strength 10 after a Handmaiden retires to the rear rank of that unit?
author: Andreas Schmidt
content: The Unit Strength 10 condition is checked at the moment the Handmaiden retires to the rear rank. If the condition is met at that time, the Lady’s effects remain active until the combat ends, even if the unit later falls below Unit Strength 10.

question: Are characters without special rule Vanguard, pre-deployment, permitted to Vanguard after joining a unit, post-deployment, with a banner that gives said unit the special rule Vanguard?
author: Andreas Schmidt
content: Yes, if the banner explicitly grants the Vanguard special rule to the entire unit then the character can Vanguard. However, the GW FAQ clarifies that a character does not gain Vanguard if it joins a unit that has the rule only in its profile. This distinction arises because Vanguard in a unit’s profile does not automatically extend to joined characters unless specifically stated by an upgrade, like a banner, that applies to the entire unit.

question: Can a cannonball hit a character, which has joined a unit with 5 or more rank and file models?
author: Andreas Schmidt
referenced_rules:
Cannon Fire CRB 226
Characters & Shooting CRB 209
content: Yes, since a cannon ball hits a model and not the unit, the character is hit (targeted by an attack that allows a specific model within the unit to be targeted). If there are 5 or more rank and file models that character is allowed to make a Look Out, Sir! - roll. This also applies to unit champions or special models within units.

question: If a unit decides to rearrange its ranks during a reform maneuver, is it limited to 5 models similar to redress the ranks?
author: Andreas Schmidt
content: No, but no model is allowed to move further than double its movement characteristic during a reform.

question: Does a unit have to do peril tests if it overlaps with the unit it is fleeing from after pivoting center-to-center away?
author: Andreas Schmidt
content: No, the unit is not fleeing "through" the unit it overlaps after the pivot, and does not make peril tests for models moving through the unit it is fleeing away from from in this way. Note: The unit must still make peril tests if it flees through any other units it is engaged with

question: There are a some items, which have restrictions for \"characters\" regarding the acess or the use of these items. Can unit champions with access to magic items buy or use these items?
author: Andreas Schmidt
content: If the type of character is not specified further (for example "beastmen chieftain only or necromancer only"), champions are allowed to take and use these items with the same restrictions. If the items have any restrictions that apply generally to Characters, those restrictions also apply to non-Characters models that can take the items.

question: What happens when a unit with Random Movement makes a Pursuit, Overrun, Flee, Fall Back in Good Order, or conducts similar movements?
author: Andreas Schmidt
content: Only use Random Movement during the Compulsory Movement phase or any movement based on the unit's Movement characteristic. For all other movement types (e.g., FBIGO, fleeing, pursuing etc.), follow the rules for the relevant move type as stated in the rulebook, including distance rolls.

question: What are the size and shape restrictions for the additional wood placed using the Woodland Ambush rule?
author: Andreas Schmidt
content: The additional wood must measure between 8" and 12" at its widest point. It should be shaped to resemble a natural wooded area. If there is any doubt about what is acceptable, check with your opponent or the Tournament Organizer. Note that some tournaments may provide pre-defined woods or have specific guidelines for their appearance.

question: Can a champion or character accept challenges regardless from its position in the fighting ranks?
turn_order: 4-1 Combat Phase Choose Combat & Determine Who Can Fight
author: Andreas Schmidt
content: A: No. Challenges can only be accepted by models which are either placed in or immediately adjacent (as non-fittiging characters) to the fighting rank engaged with the unit the challenge was issued from (or the extended fighting rank behind that in case of Infantry using the press of battle rule). While all fighting ranks in a combat are part of the battle, the wording on page 210 suggests challenges are limited to the specific engaged rank directly facing the enemy.

question: Can a character that attempts to use an ability that requires a leadership test use the 'hold your ground' ability of an undead battle standard bearer to re-roll this test?
author: Andreas Schmidt
content: Yes

question: When a unit charges a unit with the rune of hesitation, does the initative bonus apply? What does \"it\" in that rule mean - only the weapon it choses or the unit? What happens if a character wields a magic lance?
author: Andreas Schmidt
referenced_rules:
Dwarves Master Rune of Hesitation FOF 37
Who Strikes first? CRB 146
content: The initiative bonus applies since it is not a special rule. You lose any special rule on weapons and of the unit that have a relation to charging - a cavalry spear's fighting in second rank is useable, it's S and AP bonus are not. Magic weapons still have to be used (if equipped, a lance cannot be chosen), but their charge bonus is lost. The unit is not allowed to use any special rules related to chargin - First Charge, Furious Charge, Impacts hits etc. The unit still counts as having charged for external effects, if relevant for spells, other units etc.

question: For monster handlers, is the D6 roll to check whether a wound removes a handler or makes the monster lose a wound only during combat, or for any unsaved wounds?
turn_order: 4-1 Combat Phase Choose Combat & Determine Who Can Fight
author: Andreas Schmidt
content: The roll occurs for any unsaved wounds, since the last phrase of the paragraph is also not related only to combat. The "in combat" only applies to the first phrase.

question: If two units with Terror declare a charge on my regular unit, shall I make two Terror tests?
turn_order: 2-1 Movement Phase Declare Charges and Charge Reaction
author: Andreas Schmidt
content: Yes, nothing says it's limited to only one Terror test.

question: When removing casualties from the back rank, shall we commit to left to right or right to left once the rank is incomplete, or can we remove from both sides at the same time?
author: Andreas Schmidt
content: Once you removed your first casualty and the back rank is incomplete, you must continue to remove models from the same direction.

question: Which set of rules must be used for a character riding a behemoth with Howdah?
author: Andreas Schmidt
content: Split profile (chariot mount), because Howdah references Split profile (chariots)

question: Can Skaven Master assassins and Dark Elves Khainite assassins be hidden in a unit that is not deployed at the start of the game (for instance ambushers)?
author: Andreas Schmidt
content: Yes

question: When is decided the unit where Skaven Master assassins and Dark Elves Khainite assassins are hidden ?
author: Andreas Schmidt
content: When deploying characters

question: Which weapon exactly can I use with the Spectral Doppelganger spell from the Lore of Illusion?
turn_order: 4-1 Combat Phase Choose Combat & Determine Who Can Fight
author: Andreas Schmidt
content: Any melee weapon the model carries, magical or not

question: What happens when a unit charges a unit and has no other choice but to charge in a way that a third (opponent) unit is within 1\" of the charging unit
author: Andreas Schmidt
content: Since charge moves are conducted in the movement phase, the 1" rule comes to use and the units have to be nudged 1" away

question: Is a champion removed as a casualty when he is in a challenge and the whole unit is removed as a casualty, including an unsaved wound for the champion?
turn_order: 4-1 Combat Phase Choose Combat & Determine Who Can Fight
author: Andreas Schmidt
content: Yes, no Rule in champions ( 199) prevents the champion from being removed

question: Can a unit start / declare a march after it already made maneuver that you normally cannot use whilst marching?
author: Andreas Schmidt
content: No it cannot, a unit either marches or does not march.

question: Do you have to announce the use of your general’s leadership before a break or leadership test or after the test is done?
author: Andreas Schmidt
content: Since the sequence for break tests clearly states rolling first and then comparing and checking later, you can roll first and then use Inspiring Presence or not, depending on the dice roll. For leadership tests, Inspiring Presence is optional too, since under Inspiring Presence "can” is stated.

question: Can a Salamander Pack or a similar unit that is both War beasts and Regular infantry, benefit from Inspiring Presence ?
author: Andreas Schmidt
content: No, the War Beast Troop Type gives the unit the undisciplined special rule

question: Can units with the special rule dragged along be drawn by units with the special rule Fly (X)?
author: Andreas Schmidt
content: Yes, use the movement distance in the brackets of Fly(X) but move the model dragged along on the ground - not using fly movement.

question: Does the multiple wounds (X) special rule work against war machine (crews) in combat?
turn_order: 4-1 Combat Phase Choose Combat & Determine Who Can Fight
author: Andreas Schmidt
content: The crew is a single profile that loses attacks as it loses wounds. Multiple wounds works against it.

question: Motley Crew: When do you determine which casualties are removed in combat / what the majority of models is?
turn_order: 4-1 Combat Phase Choose Combat & Determine Who Can Fight
author: Andreas Schmidt
content: Check at the beginning of each initiative step when attacks are made, then remove first those models which have a majority, then remove the rest, then step forward. Note that a champion that choses a wholly different weapon counts as a separate pool. In case of a tie, the controlling player decides which armour save to use and which models to remove (you have to remove the models of which you use the armour save).

question: What happens when a unit that gives ground cannot move more than 1\" and will be within 1\" of a unit it is in combat with, be it because of terrain or other units?
author: Andreas Schmidt
content: Since giving ground is not possible, the units remain locked in combat, but all units move as far as possible and remain locked at the new position (see GW FAQ).

question: Can a Champion that is not on the table (because he is in Ambush, or hold back as Reserves) Challenge or accept the Challenge of a Warrior Duel ?
author: Andreas Schmidt
content: Yes, nothing in the wording of the rule implies that the Champion's Unit of the Marauder or their opponent have to be actually on the battlefield to fight in the Warrior Duel.

question: How many attacks do models make when fighting an enemy unit that defends an Low Linear Obstacle?
turn_order: 4-1 Combat Phase Choose Combat & Determine Who Can Fight
author: Andreas Schmidt
content: If attacking across a low linear obstacle, only 1 attack each (no base contact)

question: Does a unit gain the benefit of a defended Low linear obstacle when the charging unit ends the charge move on top of the LLO in base contact to the unit or at a part of the unit where there is no LLO
turn_order: 4-1 Combat Phase Choose Combat & Determine Who Can Fight
author: Andreas Schmidt
content: The last sentence only mentions Fly (X) as an exception, so a charging unit always suffers the disordered charge but only loses impact hits and stomp attacks and full attacks if it has no base contact/for models without base contact

question: Do units in combat or outside of line of sight of the shooting units protect \"lone characters\" from being shot at, given that they are closer to the shooting unit than the lone character?
author: Andreas Schmidt
content: No, target implies "legal target". Therefore, the unit is not able to protect the lone character and the character can be shot at if no other unit is eligible to protect that character.

question: How does the poison special rule interact with \"too tough to wound\"?
author: Andreas Schmidt
content: Any 6 to hit automatically wounds the target.

question: If a spell or ability states “all units within y may” or “all units within y gain an effect”, what happens if a unit moves outside of Y or the caster moves?
author: Andreas Schmidt
referenced_rules: Hellish Vigour Khsar's Incantation of the Desert Wind
content: All units that are within Y may benefit from that effect, given they are within Y at the time they want to use the effect (aka the effect moves with the caster for the whole duration of X).

question: Can a Skink character join a Salamander Pack, a skirmisher unit which has both Regular infantry and War beast troop sub-types ?
author: Andreas Schmidt
content: No, since skink characters do not have both regular infantry and the war beast troop type.

question: Can you decide to alter the charge path of a charging unit to avoid discarding the higher dice to make your charge successful, if you would instead fail the charge because of the terrain (by rolling a 1 and a 6 on the charge roll for instance, in addition to -1 M)?
author: Andreas Schmidt
content: Yes. You define the path taken by the unit after rolling the dice (it's already the case for wheeling to maximise contact) because you must move by the shortest route possible to reach the charge target. Make charges happen if possible.

question: Does the free wheel to align count in the charge move distance for the purpose of rules like Furious Charge and Impact Hits (reminder: When a unit wheels, every model counts as having moved as far as the outside model. Page 124)?
author: Andreas Schmidt
referenced_rules:
Aligning to the Enemy CRB 126
Who Strikes first? CRB 146
content: The free Wheel takes place after making contact. It is separated from the charge move, both for placement and initiative.

question: How many demonic gifts can a demon of chaos character buy? Are demonic gifts restricted like magic items?
author: Andreas Schmidt
content: Since there are no categories for the demonic gifts mentioned as in the rulebook for magic items, a character can buy as many different gifts as his point limit allows. Demonic gifts without an asterik can only be taken once per army and only a demonic locus can buy a single icon.

question: Can a unit with random movement move into contact with a unit that was not \"at least partly in its front arc\" as long as it fulfills all criteria for charging (single wheel etc.) stated on 126 (see GW FAQ)? For example, an enemy unit that is behind the unit with random movement but reachable with a single wheel?
author: Andreas Schmidt
content: Yes, you don't need LoS or the enemy unit to be in your front arc since you do not declare the charge. As long as you fulfill the charge criteria (shortest route, only one wheel etc.), that is a perfectly acceptable "move into contact".

question: Can you use counter charge against a redirected charge?
turn_order: 2-1 Movement Phase Declare Charges and Charge Reaction
author: Andreas Schmidt
content: No, only hold or flee are possible against a redirected charge.

question: If I am redirecting a charge and the new target was already a charged target by another unit, can this new target declare to Flee now if it already declared to Hold against its initial charging enemycharge against a redirected charge?
turn_order: 2-1 Movement Phase Declare Charges and Charge Reaction
author: Andreas Schmidt
content: Yes, the redirected charge calls to a new reaction but the only choices are Hold and Flee. The soldiers see the new enemy coming and it can change their initial decision.

question: Give Ground : A unit giving ground stops moving immediately should it come into contact with another unit or terrain. Which type of terrain is meant here?
author: Andreas Schmidt
content: Only physical terrain features that are not open ground, meaning no hills and no vortexes. Note that this also affects units already in terrain prior to the give ground move, meaning that a unit already in terrain can't give ground and instead does not move

question: Do you have to be eligible for a wizardly dispell attempt to use arcane \"instead of a (wizardly) dispell items\"?
author: Andreas Schmidt
content: Yes, the GW FAQ to Glowing Green Amulet is only about this specific item

question: What happens if a unit makes contact with another unit not being the charge target during the free wheel of alignement?
author: Andreas Schmidt
referenced_rules: Accidental Contact during a Charge CRB 131
content: If it was clear at the time of the charge declaration that the projected charge will end like this and you will hit the second unit during alignment, no matter the charge roll, you have to declare a charge against both units. If there is a slight possibility to avoid this situation, the unit should try and wheel around that unit. If it is impossible to avoid the contact in any case with the given charge roll result (but would have been with a better charge roll result), the charging unit conducts an accidental contact during a charge and may chose to either halt the charge (leading to a disordered charge with most likely only 1 model in base contact against the original charge target) or to continue (leading to a disordered charge with both units, in which the accidental contacted units might try to align). If the unit continues into a fleeing unit, the fleeing unit is destroyed and the charging unit's movement comes to an end. The charged unit wheels to align if necessary, in which case the charging unit makes a disordered charge.

question: If you declare a charge against multiple units, is that charge a failed charge if you contact one of the units only with the free wheel from aligning?
author: Andreas Schmidt
referenced_rules:
Multiple Charge Targets CRB 130
Accidental Contact during a Charge CRB 131
content: No, this is still a valid charge.

question: Does a Lion Cloak improve the models armour save if it is on a chariot? Does Korhil on a Chariot benefit from The Pelt of Charandis if he uses his Chariots armour save?
author: Andreas Schmidt
content: Since Lion Cloak is a special rule that is shared with the whole model it works. The Pelt of Charandis is an equipment that only benefits the wearer - Korhil Lionmane, so in this case he is not able to improve the armour save of the Chariot.

question: Can you cast assailment spells during a warriors duel (\"like in a challenge\")? Assailment spells are cast in every \"combat phase\", the warriors duel only states that there \"rounds of combat\"
author: Andreas Schmidt
content: Yes, rounds of combat are conducted in the combat phase, so its possible

question: When do you declare evasive against magic missiles? Before or after the casting roll?
author: Andreas Schmidt
referenced_rules:
Evasive CRB 168
Magic Missiles CRB 108
Who can Shoot? CRB 137
content: Before the casting roll is even made. The wizard then may chose to not make the casting roll. ("unit may continue with its shooting as declared")

question: Can you use the icon rakaph to pivot during an overrun move? \"Unless making a charge move, a unit carrying the Icon of Rakaph may perform a single free reform at any point during its movement.\"
author: Andreas Schmidt
content: Yes

question: Goad Beast: During the Command sub-phase of their turn, this character may goad a single friendly model whose troop type is ‘monster’ and that is within their Command range (including their own mount). Until the end of this turn, that model gains a +D3 modifier to its Attacks characteristic (to a maximum of 10). Does this also affect the rider?
author: Andreas Schmidt
content: No, only the mount, see 'including their own mount' - see Split Profile (monster mount) - The character and mount each use their own Weapon Skill, Ballistic Skill, Strength, Initiative and Attacks characteristics,

question: If a unit marches through difficult terrain, how is the movement calculated?
author: Andreas Schmidt
content: 2(M-1) - Reduce the movement characteristic by one, then double it.

question: Are hits suffered by miscast magical attacks?
author: Andreas Schmidt
content: Yes, given the nature of spellcasting, they are magical attacks

question: When calculating how many models can shoot using Volley Fire, when do you round?
author: Andreas Schmidt
content: You round after calculating the models in each rank. Example: For a unit that is 5 models wide and 5 ranks deep on level ground, 5 from the first rank, 3 each from the second (5/2=2.5, rounded to 3), third, fourth, and fifth ranks can shoot. In total, 17 models will shoot.

question: When a model steps forward during a combat, then the unit overruns into a new and unresolved combat, does the model get to make attacks?
turn_order: 4-1 Combat Phase Choose Combat & Determine Who Can Fight
author: Andreas Schmidt
content: No. A model may not make attacks during the same phase in which it stepped forward.

question: Can I contact (and so charge) an enemy unit if I already have redirected the charge of this unit this turn?
author: Andreas Schmidt
referenced_rules: Accidental Contact During A Charge CRB 131
content: Yes, the unit count as redirecting, but it has not redirected.

question: Can a unit with Random movement, or a unit that failed its stupidity test, reform when refraining to pursuit / follow up, when rallying (during fall back in good order for instance) or when destroying a fleeing enemy unit ?
author: Andreas Schmidt
content: Yes, the restrictions on not being able to perform manoeuvres are only applied when moving with their random movement dice or Movement characteristic.

question: What is happening when a model with random movement is put in base contact with a fleeing unit ? Does the unit flees again or is it destroyed ?
author: Andreas Schmidt
content: The unit is destroyed - no charge reaction is given when being contacted by a unit with random movement.

question: When a cavalry unit in Skirmish formation is charged by a unit, if the impact does not happen in the \"visual front\" of the model, shall the impacted model pivot to present its logical \"visual front\" to the charging unit ?
author: Andreas Schmidt
content: Yes, the Skirmish formation rule says the models form up "edge-to-edge and front corner to front corner, against the enemy", which cannot have other sense than "visual front" for a unit with only front arcs.

question: What happens if more than \"up to the half\" of a unit are within a terrain features clearly defined edge that counts as Woods or has the same ruling about cover?
author: Andreas Schmidt
content: The unit still counts as being in light cover.

question: How do you deteremine cover if a model can see multiple arcs of an opponent unit? [please see: ⁠Cover and Arcs ] Remember that this will also be applied to woodland boundaries and the check for cover on them.
author: Andreas Schmidt
content: Take into account only the arc the shooting model is in, then apply the rules for cover. For Skirmishers, count models individually, but only those a model could see.

question: Sometimes, when a unit of Skirmishers charges or is charged, some of the models cannot move far enough to form up with the rest of the unit. What happens to those models?
author: Andreas Schmidt
content: The unit loses coherency, as described on page 184. This means models belonging to the unit must be removed from play as casualties until the unit becomes coherent. Note that this means that all models, that have not enough movement to get to their position (formed up) in the combat are destroyed.

question: Can a character move more than twice its movement to use 'Move through the ranks' or when he joins a unit to reach the front rank?
author: Andreas Schmidt
content: Yes. Since the fighting rank is at a fixed location, he is obliged to move that distance to get to the fighting rank. The only times when a character inside of a unit is subject to this (besides normal maneuvering/moving) is Reform and Redress the ranks.

question: How do you resolve forming up with non-fitting characters in Skirmishing units?
author: Andreas Schmidt
content: Form a fighting rank, starting with the model that made contact first. Ignore the base difference for characters, the extra base size will make very little difference to the shape of the unit - maybe there will be some slight gaps inside of the unit. The controlling player may move the remaining models in any order, given that the rules for forming (up to single movement characteristic) are adhered. A character that is not in the fighting rank might then move through the ranks to get in base contact with an opponent. Remember it is not allowed to have more characters than non-characters in the fighting rank.

question: How many wailing dirges does a Mortis engine have?
author: Andreas Schmidt
content: You only do one wailing dirge attack for the whole mortis engine.

question: Does a unit partially on a hill gets cover for models, for which the LoS is obstructed by the hill?
author: Andreas Schmidt
content: Yes. (RAW)

question: Does a unit gets cover, when the LoS that checks cover is partially obstructed by a unit closer to the center of a hill?
author: Andreas Schmidt
referenced_rules:
GW FAQ
Vantage Point CRB 271
Beyond the Crest CRB 271
content: Yes

question: If a unit wants to shoot at units on a hill - do units that are on the same hill and are further from the center than the target unit block line of sight for the shooting unit?
author: Andreas Schmidt
referenced_rules:
GW FAQ
Vantage Point CRB 271
Beyond the Crest CRB 271
content: No, since they can see you over that unit, you can see them too - the rules for being closer to the center of the hill works both ways, imagine the unit closer to the center being higher elevated.

question: Can you see a unit that is only partially on a hill and can you see a model that is only partially on a hill?
author: Andreas Schmidt
referenced_rules:
GW FAQ
Vantage Point CRB 271
Beyond the Crest CRB 271
content: Yes, given no other unit closer to the center of that hill obstructs that LoS. Also Models partial on a hill see over models that are not on that hill.

question: Does a wizarding hat allow a character to buy arcane items?
author: Andreas Schmidt
content: No, GW clearly states that the wizarding hat has some unique restrictions in place. The Character cannot buy arcane items.

question: How do \"laser beam\" spells and attacks such as Gaze of Gork, Burning Gaze and Lightning Strike (from the Warp Lightning Canon) work?
author: Andreas Schmidt
content: Once the spell is cast, choose a direction, then determine the distance of the line. This line does not require a target and therefore ignores all targeting rules, i.e. it can be drawn over LoS-blocking terrain, hit models in combat, lone characters, fanatics, and models the caster doesn't have LoS to.

question: Can characters with the ambush special rule join a unit with ambush pre-placement?
author: Andreas Schmidt
content: Yes they can, use the rules for Characters and Reserves - announce each turn before rolling any dices

question: Do frenzied (or impetuous) units always have to use Swiftstride or Fly when charging
author: Andreas Schmidt
content: Yes, see GW FAQ they always will use special rules that benefit their charge.

question: What happens when only a few skirmishers are moved off the board, while coherency is being lost?
author: Andreas Schmidt
content: The whole unit is remove from the game

question: How do Skirmishers do give ground? What happens when they hit an obstacle (unit or phyiscal terrain)?
author: Andreas Schmidt
content: Determine the center / direction for the unit, then move all models paralle in this direction. If models hit an obstacle, the whole unit stops

question: How do Skirmishers conduct a flee move? What happens when they flee through units?
author: Andreas Schmidt
content: Determine center-to-center, then flee with all models parallel in this direction. If models flee through units, move the whole unit the same distance.

question: Do Skirmisher Units pivot around their centre before fleeing?
author: Andreas Schmidt
content: No, Skirmishers are moved on a model-to-model base therefore do not pivot the unit

question: If a unit with the Fly (X) special rule declares and makes a charge, when do you have to declare which Movement characteristic (Fly or normal) the unit will use?
author: Andreas Schmidt
content: Declare which movement will be used as the unit declares the charge

question: Multiple Charges into Skirmishers: What happens if you get a different side presented after forming up of the Skirmishers against the first Unit?
author: Andreas Schmidt
content: Skirmishers as GW FAQ do not have arcs, just move in the side presented to you after forming up.

question: Multiple Charges into Skirmishers: What happens if the formed up side towards your unit is \"full\" so you cannot make contact with that side?
author: Andreas Schmidt
content: Go to the side of that "arc"("flank" - remember, no arcs), but you have to able to get there with only 1 wheel, else you fail the charge

question: Multiple Charges into Skirmishers: What happens if you can go straight forward in but also you can maximize if you go into another side of the unit?
author: Andreas Schmidt
content: Charge to the side, maximizing has priority, but remember that you are only allowed to do one wheel, sometimes you will be able to do this, while sometimes you have to priorize charging over maximizing - use the principles of charging, priorizing top to bottom.

question: Can characters without the ambush special rule join a unit with ambush pre-placement?
author: Andreas Schmidt
content: No

question: Can you drill a unit that is part of multiple units charging an unit if the unit with drilled is blocked on both sides by units that charge along of that unit?
author: Andreas Schmidt
referenced_rules:
Drilled CRB 167
Multiple Charging Units CRB 130
content: No, Drilled takes place before the charge move and the units are considered to move simultaneously. Would the units charge different targets, the active player could first move the blocking units away and drill then. With multiple units charging the same target, this is not possible.

question: How do you charge Skirmishers with Skirmishers?
author: Andreas Schmidt
content: Pivot the closest skirmisher directly towards the closest visible model. Charge in straight lines as directly as possible towards the closest visible model without further pivoting or wheeling. When you make contact, align the defending model to the charging model. Then build up a fighting rank as described in the rulebook - for skirmishers vs. skirmishers, every model that is able to reach the fighting rank will do so. After that, the defending unit forms up.

question: Can a unit that is charging make use of the Drilled special rule in a way that causes accidental contact during a charge or that results in a charge against multiple targets?
author: Andreas Schmidt
referenced_rules:
Multiple Charge Targets CRB 130
Accidental Contact During a Charge CRB 131
content: No, unless the unit is in marching column and the minimum widt requested to leave the marching column already causes accidental / a multiple target charge. In that case the unit is allowed to Redress the ranks to be able to charge and conduct a multiple charge against other targets, but only against those needed to actually conduct the charge.

question: If a Doom Diver fires indirectly, do you allow for a -d3 instead of the ballistic skill and then another d3 directional correction?
author: Andreas Schmidt
content: Yes, the second part of the Doom Diver Rule referes to the indirect fire part of the bombardment rule of 225, so the first part gets applied too.

question: If a unit is not listed in the army list composition section of \"characters\", but one of its subtype is \"character\", does it counts for the 3 minimum non-character units needed for army composition? (not including ones with troop type swarm/war beastes/war machine)?
author: Andreas Schmidt
content: No, they are character units.

question: Are the attacks of \"Nurgling Infestation\" or similar abilities resolved with any weapon profile the model has equipped or in use?
author: Andreas Schmidt
content: No, treat all such attacks which explicitly state a S and AP as attacks with hand weapons with the according profile. Note that universal special rules of the model (like armour bane or poisoned attacks) will translate to these attacks, but special rules of weapons that model uses don't.

question: Can a champion move through the ranks?
turn_order: 4-1 Combat Phase Choose Combat & Determine Who Can Fight
author: Andreas Schmidt
content: No, only non-champion characters are allowed to do so.

question: When moving through the ranks to join the fighting rank, can a character choose its position?
turn_order: 4-1 Combat Phase Choose Combat & Determine Who Can Fight
author: Andreas Schmidt
content: A character can freely choose any position in the fighting rank, regardless of base contact or not.

question: Can skirmishers charge around units or change the direction multiple times during a charge?
author: Andreas Schmidt
content: No, skirmishers have to adhere to the overall guidelines of charging and are therefore only allowed to change direction once.

question: How do you flee along an impassable terrain? If a fleeing unit reaches impassable terrain, how does it move?
author: Andreas Schmidt
content: Pivot multiple times and move along it, and return to the original path of fleeing if possible / as good as possible

question: If I have multiple characters' base does not fit neatly (non-fitting bases) can they go on the same side?
author: Andreas Schmidt
content: The characters join the front of the unit and are placed on either the left or right flank, as shown in Figure (need reference from rules). Only one such character can be placed on each flank of the unit. For determining marching column or combat order, these models are ignored.

question: Does a champion count for the bretonnia exiles blessing if slain in a challenge - or can a champion even get a blessing of the lady if he kills a character or champion in a challenge?
author: Andreas Schmidt
content: No, only non-champion characters are counting for this and a champion cannot get the blessing separately from the unit

question: Can a champion shoot magic missiles (from bound spells or wizarding hat or if he is a wizard) into another target than his unit?
author: Andreas Schmidt
referenced_rules:
Characters and Shooting CRB 209
Champions CRB 199
content: Yes, the wording for characters on 209 is the same as for champions on 199. This heavily implies that the exemption also counts for champions.

question: Can characters shoot multiple magic missiles per turn into different targets? A lone character would still be treated as a unit and therefore has to target the same unit?
author: Andreas Schmidt
content: Yes he can, the exemption for magic missiles on 209 is to be applied - a character can divide his magic missiles into different targets, chosing targets when each spell is cast.

question: Do models with the fly (x) rule suffer a -1 movement penalty and have to use the lowest of 2d6 when charging while starting their movement in terrain.
author: Andreas Schmidt
content: Yes, models with fly (x) always begin their movement on the ground, and any unit that start their movement in terrain suffers its effects.

question: With the new GW FAQ about taking wheeling into account for allowing charges, can you declare charges with Swiftstride if the opponent is within M+9 but with wheel M+12?
author: Andreas Schmidt
content: The opponent unit has to be both within M+9 maximum charge range and it has to be possible to conduct the charge with M+9 including the wheels.

question: How is a unit of skirmishers moved by the spell Travel Mystical Pathway?
author: Andreas Schmidt
content: Move each model individually up to 12", maintaining coherency and at least 6" away from any enemy unit.

question: Can you cast a Remains in Play spell, that is already casted?
author: Andreas Schmidt
content: Yes. While the rulebook says no, GW FAQ clarifies that the spell can be attempted to cast, but the current active spell is ended on the attempt.

question: What happens if two friendly units that stand base-to-base next to each other win combat and their opponent flees from them not straight backwards. Can they pursuit? If they pivot to align center-to-center, they would both overlap with each other.
author: Andreas Schmidt
content: Pursuit moves are done one after each other. During a Pivot, units ignore the presence of other units. While you go straight forward after that pivot and you cannot wheel to maximize or go around other units, consider this pivot being part of the pursuit move. First pivot, then pursuit with one unit, then with another. In most cases, this will lead to the second unit being blocked to move, but the first unit is able to pursuit.

question: If Galrauch fails a leadership test, when does the condition end?
author: Andreas Schmidt
content: Until the start of his next turn, since he has to test again

question: Should all effects that impact stand and shoot apply to all rules that utilize it as a function such as fire and flee?
turn_order: 2-1 Movement Phase Declare Charges and Charge Reaction
author: Andreas Schmidt
referenced_rules:
Stand & Shoot CRB 120
Fire & Flee CRB 169
content: Yes, errata all rules that impact stand and shoot to apply to any rule that uses it as part of its functions (Banner of Chalons, Quick Shot)

question: In order to overrun, a unit must destroy its enemy completely. Which \"enemies\" are meant by this?
author: Andreas Schmidt
content: This refers to all enemy units the unit is engaged in combat with—specifically, those in base contact. In combats involving multiple units, even if the enemy units in direct base contact are wiped out, the unit remains part of the combat until end of turn. Combat results still factor in this unit, and it must undergo any required break tests and suffer all consequences.

question: What happens when a model that belongs to a unit of multiple wound models suffers a hit or a wound, specifically by a source that hits models (dangerous terrain tests, peril tests, cannon fire)?
author: Andreas Schmidt
content: Besides the champion, always use the rule for removing casualties from multiple wound models ( 102). Resolve the hits against the specific model but if another model is already wounded, that model will suffer the lost wounds - always allocate wounds to one model after another. If a model would lose more wounds than it has in its wound characteristic by such attacks or hits, the unit will only use that many wounds as are left on that specific model.

question: How do you follow up? And what happens if, while performing the follow up move towards a unit that Gives Ground, the unit would contact instead another enemy unit that was not in the combat? Is it accidental contact or should movement stop at 1\" from the unit that would be contacted?
author: Andreas Schmidt
referenced_rules:
Accidental Contact CRB 130
Follow Up CRB 156
content: To conduct a follow up move, do the opposite of give ground: move directly towards the enemy unit that gave ground, without turning, pivoting or otherwise changing its facing in any way until you make contact or until you stop because of contact with an impassable terrain or friendly unit. If you contact another enemy unit, this is accidental contact (pg. 131). if the enemy unit is contacted in the rear or flank, or if it is already in combat, nudge that unit and any units it is in combat with) aside and conduct the follow up move. If the enemy unit is contacted in its front, it can chose to accept the combat, effectively stopping the follow up move or give ground to avoid it.

question: Can you decide not to use Lore Familiar, even if the wizard bought the item?
author: Andreas Schmidt
content: If the Wizard opts not to do it they don’t get any spells at all RAW

question: What happens when a model with a shooting attack that wounds against its target's initiative characteristic targets a war machine (or chariot)?
turn_order: 3-3 Shooting Phase Roll to Wound & Make Armour Saves
author: Andreas Schmidt
referenced_rules:
Split Profile CRB 97
Split Profile Warmachines CRB 197
content: Use the initiative value elsewhere on the model (the crew)

question: Regarding the Challenges & Mounts Change - how do you determine which attacks are lost?
turn_order: 4-1 Combat Phase Choose Combat & Determine Who Can Fight
author: Andreas Schmidt
content: If one participant of the challenge is slain in one initiative step, all attacks with a lower initiative in this combat are lost and will not be conducted. You can only score overkill from attacks of the same initiative of the step in which the participant is slain.

question: Can you still Counter Charge on turn 1 after a Vanguard move?
turn_order: 2-1 Movement Phase Declare Charges and Charge Reaction
author: Andreas Schmidt
content: Yes. The new ruling states that you cannot declare a charge during your first turn. Counter Charge would be in the opponent's first turn

question: How do poisoned attacks work? Can i chose which attacks get the bonus after the wound roll? How does it work with multiple models or attacks against multiple units or characters?
author: Andreas Schmidt
content: Keep it as simple as possible - Just separate the poison hits from your normal attacks after directing attacks to the target and roll a separate batch of dices for the wound roll of these poisoned attacks. Keep dice batches for different targets separate during both to hit and to wound. Poisoned hits wil always apply to wound rolls of the same type of attacks they were made of in case the model has different weapons

question: Spider Banner: Can the unit wound automatically?
author: Andreas Schmidt
content: No they can't, they just get Poison on natural 5+ instead of 6 if they already had poison before.

question: Big Smartz: If a unit failed a stupidity test but succeeds another one before my next start of turn sub-phase, is the unit still stupid ?: Can the unit wound automatically?
author: Andreas Schmidt
content: No, a stupid unit ceases to be stupid if it succeeds a stupidity test.

question: What happens when a model that belongs to a unit of single wound models has multiple hits allocated specifically to this model? (for example Tree Whack)
author: Andreas Schmidt
content: If the model and not the unit is hit, the model is killed, but wounds from additional hits do not spill over to other models

question: How do you determine in which arc of a charge target a single model is?
author: Andreas Schmidt
content: Only check the front edge of the model - if the majority of the front edge of a model is in one arc, then charge this arc. If you cannot come to an agreement with your opponent, charge the arc which offers the lower combat resolution
