question: Is the Sapper \"Dig in\" rule to be played the same way as Earthen Ramparts now? And what exactly do both grant?
author: Andreas Schmidt
content: Yes, and units can only do 1 Attack per model, no impact hits, no stomp attacks.

question: Do one-handed magic weapons, which do not count as any other weapon type, qualify for the Parry special rule of Infantry?
turn_order: 4-1 Combat Phase Choose Combat & Determine Who Can Fight
author: Andreas Schmidt
content: Only if the weapon is specifically stated to be or count as hand weapon (right now that is only the wollopa one hit wounda after use)

question: Do Parry (from Infantry) and Parry (Guardians of Talsyn) stack?
turn_order: 4-1 Combat Phase Choose Combat & Determine Who Can Fight
author: Andreas Schmidt
content: Yes, but note that the normal Parry will only be granted if fighting with a hand weapon, not with an Asrai Spear

question: How do the Arrows of Isha and the Seafarer Bow interact?
author: Andreas Schmidt
content: You take the best of the two profiles of Bow. This effectively gives Bow of the Seafarer with Arrows of Isha the profile; AP-3 AB(1)."

question: If a unit A is engaged with two units B and C, one (B) of which is a single character in a challenge, the rules say that all models of the first unit A which normally must attack the character B due to closeness instead are allowed to attack the other unit C. How does this work with fighting ranks and \"full attacks\"?
turn_order: 4-1 Combat Phase Choose Combat & Determine Who Can Fight
author: Andreas Schmidt
referenced_rules:
Who can fight CRB 145
How many attacks? CRB 146
Multiple Units in Combat CRB 147
content: Since "the unit" is specified in the FAQ about fighting ranks, only the models within M" of Unit C can attack that unit. Please note that these models only get to make 1 A, regardless if they are in base contact with B or not.

question: Does the change in Regeneration mean that i can use a Regeneration save for any case a model loses a wound, even if just losing a wound is stated? E.g. can you attempt a Regeneration save against Peril Tests, Unstable, Deamonic Instability, Dangerous Terrain and similar cases?
author: Andreas Schmidt
content: Yes, as long that it is not mentioned that regeneration saves are not permitted against these attacks. Please note that due to the old wording of regeneration, Killing Blow, Monster Slayer and similar wordings do NOT allow regeneration saves to be made against the wounds lost with these special rules.

question: Does the new FAQ entry of the Fighting Rank mean that all ranks and files which have only one model in contact with opponent models count as Fighting Ranks?
turn_order: 4-1 Combat Phase Choose Combat & Determine Who Can Fight
author: Andreas Schmidt
referenced_rules:
GW FAQ
The Fighting Rank CRB 145
content: When two opposing units are engaged in combat, only one row of models—the rank or file that is both in base contact and aligned (or almost in disordered charges) to the enemy’s engaged row—is considered the fighting rank. Other ranks or files that merely contain a single model in contact do not count as fighting ranks. Exceptions to this rule apply only to units in Lance Formation, Skirmishers, and Infantry (which has two fighting ranks in some cases), which may have different fighting rank rules.

question: How would situations resolved where a character without the First Charge rule joins a unit that has it and vice versa?
author: Andreas Schmidt
content: As long as one model with the rule First Charge is performing its first charge of the game within a unit, the special rule is used and counts as being used for all models that participated in that charge and have the First Charge special rule in that unit

question: When fighting against a unit in lance formation, can models in infantry units (using \"Press of Battle\") in the second rank use all of their attacks?
author: Andreas Schmidt
content: Normally they would only have one attack since they do not have base contact. The lance formation rule states that every model in the fighting rank is considered in base contact. This means YES - all models can do all of their attacks and all models in the fighting ranks, independent from their distance to the lance, can fight.

question: Do i have to maximize with a lance charging another unit?
author: Andreas Schmidt
content: No, since the lance automatically is in base contact, you don't have to maximize at all - just charge the closest way in.

question: If one of the participants of a challenge is defending a Low linear obstacle, are both characters treated as being in base to base contact?
turn_order: 4-1 Combat Phase Choose Combat & Determine Who Can Fight
author: Andreas Schmidt
content: No, still treat them as having the LLO between them - 1 Attack each and no Stomp Attacks.

question: Can you do a second bombing run with the Sky Lantern or Gyrocopter or do a second Wake of Fire Attack with the Flamespyre Phoenix and similar attacks which are triggered just by moving close or over the opponent when moving with Arcane Urgency or the Rune of Haste and Urgency?
author: Andreas Schmidt
content: Yes, given the ability does not have a restriction regarding the number (once per remaining move phase or similar) which it can be used per turn or in total.

question: Can a Dwarf with a weapon that has Weapon runes inscribed on it use Parry?
author: Andreas Schmidt
content: As long as the weapon is a hand weapon.

question: What happens if a character joins a single rank unit?
author: Andreas Schmidt
content: The character goes to the first rank, displacing one model to a newly formed second rank, as described under Positioning Characters.

question: With the new ruling on shooting at characters that have joined a unit with different troop type, how do you process that shooting?
author: Andreas Schmidt
content: The character is targeted instead of the unit. All Line of Sight and Range are measured towards the character. Note that the unit is not able to use evasive or similar special rules and the character cannot be protected by 'Lone character' rules.

question: How do you calculate the correct armour save if you have Parry, other modifiers, and Armour Piercing?
turn_order: 4-1 Combat Phase Choose Combat & Determine Who Can Fight
author: Andreas Schmidt
content: Parry cannot improve your armour save beyond a 3+ value. This means that when calculating the base armour save (before any roll modifiers), Parry will cap the result at 3+ if not improved by other means. However, if the unit is affected by a rule that modifies the armour save value itself (e.g. Plague of Rust), you can balance positive and negative modifiers against each other. For example Rune of Oath & Steel. Note that modifiers to the armour save roll—like Armour Piercing, Totem of Rust, etc.—do not interact with this cap and leave it at 3+. They apply after the save value is determined, and reduce the final roll needed for success.

question: If an infantry model that has an 2+ Armour Save (without parry), fights with hand weapon and shield - does it have to use parry and only has a 3+ Asv as the consequence?
turn_order: 4-1 Combat Phase Choose Combat & Determine Who Can Fight
author: Andreas Schmidt
content: While the model has to use parry, parry only improves the armour save - therefore, the model retains its 2+ Asv. Note that you cannot use the parry bonus to get to a 2+ Armour Save by any means.

question: Can you take a virtue of the duty or ideal even if that means that your general has not the highest Ld in your army?
author: Andreas Schmidt
content: Yes, only the BSB is mentioned in GWs FAQ on the highest leadership. This also means in your army you can include mercenaries or other characters that are not able to be the general with a higher leadership than your general.

question: If a unit with the Ethereal or the Grinding Wheel (Steam Tank/Iron Daemon) special rule charges an enemy that is defending a low linear obstacle (or counts as with Earthen Ramparts and the Sapper Rule), what happens?
author: Andreas Schmidt
content: Yes. They can charge and will only contact the LLO, losing impact hits and can only do one attack per model. Note that for a Steam Tank and an Iron Daemon LLOs count as open terrain, so they can actually ignore the LLO and contact the unit directly, effectively denying the defending of the LLO for them, charging on top of a physical LLO or just in base contact in the case of Earthen Ramparts/Entrenched.

question: How do you charge a unit behind a defended Low linear obstacle?
author: Andreas Schmidt
content: Charge the LLO and align towards the LLO instead of the unit. Note that you have to charge the LLO in a way that at least one model of the charging unit is in the front arc of the defending unit, else the charge is considered to be a failed charge. Maximise in a way that as many models as possible are within M" of each other. Also remember that a Lance blunts if charging a unit behind a LLO because it is considered to have conducted a disordered charge.

question: Does the ability 'Thunderous Impact' of the Grand Army of Cathay stack?
author: Andreas Schmidt
content: It is a special rule with a modifier, which stack per default. Also in the wording, "the strike point" is mentioned, so it stacks for each strike point, similar to Mortis Engines.

question: Since AP modifies the Dice Roll and not the Armour Save, does the Armour of Meteoric Iron work against attacks with Armour Piercing (X)?
author: Andreas Schmidt
content: Yes, the intent of the Armour of Meteoric Iron is clearly to prevent Armour Piercing to apply. Note that the Armour of Meteoric Iron is a heavy Armour as noted in the italics and thus a suit of armour.

question: How do you determine how many models can strike back when a unit has two fighting ranks?
turn_order: 4-1 Combat Phase Choose Combat & Determine Who Can Fight
author: Andreas Schmidt
content: When resolving combat, GW FAQ states that models in the Fighting Rank that are able to fight are removed and after that models that are able to fight in the Supporting rank (Spears) are removed. Note that the FAQ on the Fighting Rank specifies that only models within M" are able to fight, so remove these models from the Fighting Rank first, reducing their attacks and then reduce models in the Supporting rank within M" to reduce the supporting attacks. After that, the unit cannot strike back (except for characters and champion) and casualties are applied to the unit normally. If the unit has two fighting ranks, you may choose from which of the two ranks and from which side to remove models. For single-rank units, alternate the removal of models from each end of the fighting rank.

question: How do abilities like Gnashing Maws (gigantic spawn of chaos) interact with regeneration? What about effects that trigger when a model loses its last wound, such as Timmm-berr! or Explosive Demise (warpfire dragon)?
author: Andreas Schmidt
content: Regeneration is no longer a save, so a wound from Gnashing Maws counts as an unsaved wound regardless of whether regeneration is successful. Effects that require a model to lose its last wound will only trigger if the model actually destroyed and removed as a casualty.

question: Can an engineer in combat use a pigeon bomb?
author: Andreas Schmidt
content: No because this is "instead of shooting normally", so the engineer needs to be able to shoot

question: Can a model direct his impact hits on a champion if there is base contact?
turn_order: 4-1 Combat Phase Choose Combat & Determine Who Can Fight
author: Andreas Schmidt
content: Yes, there is a paragraph in characters that prevents doing it on characters (if there are 5+ r&f models in the unit) and no such things for champions

question: Given the FAQ for Open Orders Quick Turn - does this apply to Lumbering aswell?
author: Andreas Schmidt
content: Only Quick Turn is mentioned, Lumbering can still be used outside of sequence

question: When items or abilites do enhance the Range of a Spell, do they also enhance the range of spell effects that are explained in the spells' description?
author: Andreas Schmidt
content: Only the range for targeting units is extended, so spell effects are not increased. In Detail: For Vortex Spells, the range of effect is not enhanced, only the range for template placement. For Conveyance pells, the target range is increased but not the range of replacement (Travel Mystical Pathways, Infernal Gateway). For Spells with Self range, nothing is increased. For Gaze of Gork, the Range is extended.

question: Can characters that joined a unit of the same troop type be targeted by enemy shooting if there are fewer than five rank and file models (of the same troop type) in the unit they have joined?
author: Andreas Schmidt
content: No, the only change that GW's errata makes is to prevent characters of different types from receiving the protection enjoyed by same-type characters in units. When there are fewer than five rank and file models in a unit, the second paragraph of "Enemy Shooting" in the errata gives you instructions of how such characters can be hit when their units aren't of sufficient size.

question: Stupidity: What happens if a stupid unit breaks and flees, FBIGO or gives ground?
author: Andreas Schmidt
content: The unit does flee, give ground etc, but cannot reform when rallying, changing face or doing similar abilities - it will just conduct flee moves and give ground. Note that this also mean that you cannot use TMP or similar spells on the unit.

question: Can conveyance spells be cast on units or targets who already moved during that Movement Phase, including charging, fleeing or moving during the compulsory moves?
author: Andreas Schmidt
content: Unless otherwise specified in the spell's description, conveyance spells can be cast on any valid friendly unit, respecting the normal criteria for choosing a target (i.e. within the caster's vision arc and range, not engaged in combat). Specific constraints and/or allowances may be defined in the spell's description, e.g. regarding the target unit/character's movement before and/or after the spell, or whether it is fleeing or engaged in combat.

question: Can you defend a Low linear obstacle with Skirmishers?
author: Andreas Schmidt
referenced_rules:
GW FAQ
Skirmishers in Combat CRB 185
content: No, since you do not have a front rank. However, if you are under the effect of an ability that counts the unit as defending a LLO (Earthen Ramparts, Entrench, etc...) you get the bonus. Note however, that some of these rules cease to apply when the unit moves; forming up to a charging enemy (among other things) would remove these benefits.

question: Low linear obstacles and Flank Charges - the rules only state the unit is counting as defending a LLO. Does a unit defending a LLO get the bonus to all arcs?
author: Andreas Schmidt
referenced_rules:
GW FAQ
Defended Low Linear Obstacle CRB 270
content: Only the Front arc counts as being defended, even for a LLO that is magically summoned or an entrenched unit. If the charging unit charges on the flank and has not sufficient movement to charge around the LLO to get into the flank, it is allowed to straddle the LLO and charge through difficult terrain, ending up disrupted.

question: How do you defend an Low linear obstacle? Aka how do you move up to it to defend it?
author: Andreas Schmidt
content: You have to wheel forward, until your front rank is parallel aligned with the LLO. If you do not have sufficient movement, you cannot defend the LLO

question: Do Characters in units count against the minimum US for scoring units?
author: Andreas Schmidt
content: Yes, regardless of their unit type

question: If a unit suffers more unsaved wounds than it has remaining wounds and has the Regeneration special rule, how many Regeneration saves does it have to roll?
author: Andreas Schmidt
content: Excess wounds are applied after Regeneration. However, remember that Regeneration saves are not mandatory. The unit can chose to not roll a single regeneration save to not give up more CR than it has remaining wounds. If the unit choses to roll Regeneration saves, it can chose to roll any number up to the number of unsaved wounds. After all Regeneration saves have been made, the unit loses an amount of unsaved wounds up to the maximum of its remaining wound count.

question: Since Killing Blow / Monster Slayer only states \"roll a 6 on a wound roll\" and Ethereal states \"cannot be wounded\" - does Killing Blow / Monster Slayer with non-magical attacks actually work against Ethereal?
author: Andreas Schmidt
referenced_rules:
Ethereal CRB 167
Killing Blow CRB 172
Monster Slayer CRB 173
content: No! Killing Blow / Monster Slayer states that there has to be an "unsaved wound" for it to work - but Ethereal units can only be wounded by magical attacks.

question: Does Heavenly Beacon ability of Sky Lantern stack?
author: Andreas Schmidt
content: Yes

question: Can you shoot a model with the Column of Fire Rule in a way that you hit a combat?
author: Andreas Schmidt
content: No, similar to normal cannons, since you aim with a weapon that has this rule, you cannot risk shooting in a way that you hit combat (see the wording of "intended target")

question: How is the -1 to hit from Fear applied in multi-unit combats if the Leadership test is failed?
turn_order: 4-1 Combat Phase Choose Combat & Determine Who Can Fight
author: Andreas Schmidt
content: The -1 is applied to the unit that fails the test against all units that cause fear and have a higher US then the unit that failed the test in this combat.

question: If a Skaven Character uses his verminous valour rule, does he retire, thus any special rules he contributes to the unit are lost and he cannot enter the fighting rank again in subsequent phases of combat?
author: Andreas Schmidt
content: Yes. Verminous valour is clear: the character retires. Follow the normal rules for characters retiring, with the exception that the character will continue to confer their leadership to the unit. However, the character has not refused a challenge, and is therefore able to move through the ranks agin in future round of combat.

question: What happens if a Cathayan Warmachine which has an Ogre attached to it is removed as a casualty (but the ogre has remaining wounds)?
author: Andreas Schmidt
content: The Ogre stays alive and is now a simple character on its own. Note that his victory points are still granted similar to fanatics

question: Since skirmishers require line of sight from more than 50% the models in the unit to declare a charge, is this also required for a counter charge?
turn_order: 2-1 Movement Phase Declare Charges and Charge Reaction
author: Andreas Schmidt
content: Yes, a unit can only use Counter Charge against an enemy they are allowed to charge.

question: Can you touch the flank of a unit to charge the front corner, if the full front arc/rank of the unit is already occupied by another unit of your own (or opponent)?
author: Andreas Schmidt
content: If the full front arc is occupied, according to GW, you cannot charge the front at all. If even the tiniest bit of the front is unoccupied on a corner, you can do a disordered charge against the corner but note that you have to be able to position before aligning.

question: In the notes of the Iron Hail Gun it specifies the following, \"Notes: A model armed with an iron hail gun suffers no negative modifiers for firing at long range, for using the Multiple Shots (D3) special rule, or whilst making a Stand & Shoot charge reaction.\" Does this effect only apply to the use of the Iron Hail Gun, or the model as a whole?
author: Andreas Schmidt
content: Just the iron hail gun, as the note is part of the weapon's rules, it only applies to the weapon.

question: If you lost frenzy, can you regain it by another source?
author: Andreas Schmidt
content: Yes you can. You can even re-gain frenzy by the same source, like Blood Rage. Note that if a BSB with a Banner or a character with an source that grants Frenzy (and does not state it can be regained or never lost) loses frenzy and joins a new unit, that unit won't be frenzied.

question: Can you refuse a challenge in a combat with multiple eligible characters, where at least one of those characters cannot refuse a challenge, but others could?
turn_order: 4-1 Combat Phase Choose Combat & Determine Who Can Fight
author: Andreas Schmidt
content: No, at least one eligible character has to accept the challenge.

question: Characters ignore other models in their unit for LoS purposes. Does this work for over 50% of a skirmish unit needing LoS to charge?
author: Andreas Schmidt
content: It is applied for Shooting, but not for charging. Use the Skirmisher LoS rules for charging. For Shooting, the character ignores other models of the same unit.

question: Does the move that leads up to a situation where you count as having charged count as a charge move (for the purposes of special rules such as furious charge, frenzy and so on)?
turn_order: 4-1 Combat Phase Choose Combat & Determine Who Can Fight
author: Andreas Schmidt
content: Yes, as long as you meet all the other requirements eg move 3“ etc.

question: Do skirmishers need to form up again when contacting an enemy unit while pursuing or overruning?
author: Andreas Schmidt
content: No, skirmishers keep their formed up shape while pursuing. Therefore, they do not need to form up again, they align against the enemy instead upon contact

question: Do Ethereal Units have to make Peril tests when fleeing through another unit?
author: Andreas Schmidt
content: Yes, while they cannot be wounded by magical attacks, Peril Tests cause a unit to lose a wound, not to suffer a wound, so units with the Ethereal special rule have to do peril tests just as other units do.

question: If an enemy unit loses combat and will Give Ground off the battlefield, what are the winning unit's options?
author: Andreas Schmidt
content: The winner can attempt to restrain and reform as normal. If the unit would Follow Up, they do not move as there is no enemy to move into contact with (and a unit can only overrun if the enemy is destroyed before the break test).

question: Is it possible for skirmish models to pivot or wheel during normal moves / marching or charging?
author: Andreas Schmidt
content: Yes, given that no point of the model exceeds its maximum movement. Also note that you are only allowed to change your path of direction (aka wheel) only once during a skirmishers charge move. However, to make combat engagements possible at all, skirmishers can freely pivot during any time of their movement (charges and normal movement) without changing their path of movement.

question: Can Champions take 25 pts more points in Royal Clan or Wild Herd or similar Armies of Infamy?
author: Andreas Schmidt
referenced_rules:
Arcane Journal Beastmen Brayherds
Arcene Journal Dwarf Mountain Holds
content: No

question: If a unit has to test for Restrain or Impetuous and wants to use the Inspiring Presence of a General,which is not inside the unit but has a modified leadership from warband, can the unit use the warband modifier on that generals modified leadership for this test?
author: Andreas Schmidt
content: Yes. The unit uses the modified leadership of the general via Inspiring Presence and does not use the Warband Modifier - the General uses it. The GW FAQ notes that only "a Warband" and thus the unit itself cannot use it.

question: When do units actually conduct Overrun?
author: Andreas Schmidt
content: Overrun is a pursuit move. The unit has the choice to attempt to restrain or reform, same as for Pursuit or to Overrun and makes then a normal pursuit move bust moves directly forwards. So, the unit moves after break tests.

question: When a Warband unit makes a leadership test and uses the Inspiring Presence of a warband general (that is not in the unit). How are the multiple warband bonuses applied to this leadership test? Note that this question only adresses the warband modifier and refers to the wording of the Warband special rule.
author: Andreas Schmidt
content: Only the warband modifier of the Generals unit (if he is in a warband unit) is used. If the general is not in a warband unit, then no warband modifier can be claimed.

question: A unit affected by certain spells (Earthen Ramparts), formation (marching column) or that has rallied cannot charge or make a charge move. Random Movement has to adhere to all charge criteria during the move \"as any other charging unit\". Does being unable to charge prevent a model using Random Movement from entering combat during Compulsory Movement?
author: Andreas Schmidt
content: Yes. Contacting a unit with Random Movement is basically charging. You cannot make contact, those units have to stop 1" away from the enemy unit while unable to charge and will not trigger any rules affected by charging. Note that units cannot use Counter Charge under these conditions at all, as clarified by GW FAQ.

question: When charging a unit in an arc that features an incomplete rank, how are you to make contact with that unit?
author: Andreas Schmidt
content: Use the footprint of the unit, extending the incomplete rank or file to be complete, and have the charging unit make contact (and maximize contact with) models who would be in those positions.

question: Do fanatics now die when moving through a unit that is entrenched or under the effect of Earthen Ramparts?
author: Andreas Schmidt
content: If the unit is under the effect of Earthen Ramparts but wasn’t charged, they hit the unit since earthen ramparts specifies it only works if charged. Against entrenched or earthen ramparts when charged, the fanatics hit the obstacle and die.

question: Can you use Wailing Dirge after Charging, failed Charges or Marching?
author: Andreas Schmidt
content: No. While Charging and failed Charging are no stated exclusively, since Wailing Dirge is an attack made in the shooting phase (Shooting Attack), it can't be used after Charging, even being a special rule (like other shooting attacks resolving from special rules) since the permission is not granted by the special rule.

question: When a character or champion retires from combat, is moved for a challenge, or moves through the ranks, does this count as the unit moving for the purpose of related special rules (such as being 'entrenched')?
author: Andreas Schmidt
content: No. The character (or champion) counts as moving when they retire, but the unit itself does not.

question: Can I choose for reserves to enter during any player’s turn?
author: Andreas Schmidt
content: No, only on your own turns.

question: Do modifiers to the To Hit roll apply when using the Seal of Parravon?
author: Andreas Schmidt
content: Yes. The Seal of Parravon refers to a roll of 3 on the To Hit table before modifiers (i.e., the result after consulting the table, not the natural dice roll). Modifiers are applied as normal.

question: Can the champion of a unit which swapped their shields for another weapon still buy a magical shield? And can the champion chose to wield a separate equipment than the unit (if he wears a mundane/magical weapon?)?
author: Andreas Schmidt
content: Yes, just like how a character doesn't have to buy a generic shield in order to have a magic one. You just need the shield as a possible option to access the magic version. Yes, the champion can use a different weapon option if he has access to.

question: If Chalice of Dark Rain is active, can a casket of souls use a magical missile? Are wailing dirges affected by it?
author: Andreas Schmidt
content: Only the range of missile weapons is halved´, so the range of Magic Missiles, Wailing Dirge, Breath Weapons and similar rules are not affected (Sky Lantern Bombs), but war machines cannot shoot at all. Since the casket's magic missile is a shooting attack, it cannot be used in such a turn.

question: If a model, that was already in a fighting rank, steps up into another fighting rank, can that model attack that turn?
turn_order: 4-1 Combat Phase Choose Combat & Determine Who Can Fight
author: Andreas Schmidt
referenced_rules:
Stepping Forward & Closing In CRB 150
GW FAQ
content: The model that steps up may only direct attacks against an enemy unit that it could have attacked prior to stepping up. Use the model's original position to determine what it can attack and how many attacks it can make.

question: Can Sappers use their ability \"Dig in!\" in every command phase or only in their own?
author: Andreas Schmidt
content: The wording of the special rule "Dig in!" has priority over the general rules for command abilities, thus the special rule can be used in every command phase.

question: If a unit of skirmishers takes casualties and has no other choice than to remove models in a way that two or more characters that have joined said unit lose coherency with the unit, what happens to the characters?
author: Andreas Schmidt
content: Any model out of coherency, including characters, is removed from play as casualty.

question: Do you get to chose a charge reaction if accidentally contacted during a charge, for example if a charged unit choses flee and flees through a friendly unit - and the charging unit would hit that said friendly unit if it continues to charge?
author: Andreas Schmidt
referenced_rules:
Accidental Contact during a Charge CRB 131
Pursuit into a fresh Enemy CRB 157
content: This is accidental contact during a charge. Follow the procedure on 131 - the charging unit only counts as having redirect prior so it can make contact - you don't get a charge reaction, which only is available after a unit is selected as charge target during a redirect or charge declaration. Note this also means you do not get a charge reaction if an enemy unit pursuits or overruns into you as explained on 157.

question: Can an assailment spell be cast from any position in the unit? Does he need to have base contact?
turn_order: 4-1 Combat Phase Choose Combat & Determine Who Can Fight
author: Andreas Schmidt
content: The caster has only to be within the fighting rank that is engaged with the unit he wants to target and does not necessarily needs to have base contact to that unit. Note that assailment spells do not lose hits if there is no base contact.

question: When do you determine which models can attack during a combat? For example, if a character retires using verminous valour or similar abilities after making its attacks, can a model with a lower initiative replacing it in the fighting rank still make its attacks?
turn_order: 4-1 Combat Phase Choose Combat & Determine Who Can Fight
author: Andreas Schmidt
referenced_rules:
Choose Combat &
Determine Who Can Fight CRB 145ff
content: When the combat is chosen, after challenges are issued and characters moved through the ranks, check which models are in which fighting rank and whom they can attack. Models that step into a fighting rank later or that are added later to a fighting rank cannot attack in that fighting rank. See also ID356.

question: The Sea Dragon Cloak is a special rule / equipment of the Dark Elves that allows for a 2+ armour save. Does this overwrite the general GW FAQ rule with rules priority where monsters have a 3+ armour save max?
author: Andreas Schmidt
content: No. Regardless the Equipment, chariots, war machines and monsters can only have a 3+ armour save max.

question: Clarification of the Grail Reliquae.
author: Andreas Schmidt
content: The Grail Reliquae is a single model. It might have the stats of 6 Pilgrims but it's still just a single Heavy Infantry model, which has a Unit Strength of 1. No matter how many wounds it suffers it still has 6 attacks. It is not in Marching Column if it's the only model remaining as single models cannot be in Marching Column. Attacks cannot be directed against the Grail Reliquae - all hits will be assigned to the unit. This means the unit will not benefit from the Blessing unless the Grail Reliquae is the last remaining model. If a template hits the Grail Reliquae, it results in a normal hit assigned to the unit - note that "risking being hit" for the Grail Reliquae works the same way as for any other model with that base size.

question: A unit affected by certain spells (Earthen Ramparts) or formations (marching column) cannot charge or make a charge move. Units that pursue/overrun into an enemy count as having made a charge move (if you contact an enemy unit). Does being unable to charge prevent those units from entering combat?
author: Andreas Schmidt
content: No, a charge move/charging is only made during the Charge phase. Pursuit/overrun into an enemy unit are unaffected by effects that prevent them from charging - they just count as having charged if they make contact

question: When are ambushers declared?
author: Andreas Schmidt
content: just like scouts, units with Ambushers can be deployed normally until characters are deployed. A unit with both scouts and ambushers can either be deployed as a scout, or be placed in ambush if they still haven't been places after their owner declared that they have placed all scouting units.

question: Can stomp attacks in a challenge be also directed towards the unit?
turn_order: 4-1 Combat Phase Choose Combat & Determine Who Can Fight
author: Andreas Schmidt
content: No

question: Due to the GW FAQ about objects being removed from the table, what is an object?
author: Andreas Schmidt
content: Anything that has a real or represented (by template) physical presence on the board that is present for more than a single sub-phase. A unit is a type of object, for example, as is a magical vortex

question: In the army list for most Armies of Infamy, there will be a text box stating: \"Any models that have the option to purchase magic items will have the option to purchase Common or (Faction) magic items). How does this apply to models in the army that are drawn from army books with a different selection of magic items?
author: Andreas Schmidt
content: Models can select magic items from their original army book only (Shaggoths in Wolves of the Sea get only Beastmen items).

question: When an attack that uses a template (such as Bombardment or an assailment or magic missile that uses a 3\" or 5\" blast) scatters to be partially off the table, how is this resolved?
author: Andreas Schmidt
content: Template attacks resolved fully even if the template is partially off the table.

question: If a mounted model casts a spell or uses an ability that affects the caster (such as Mantle of Ghorok), but does not reference other models, does the spell affect the caster's mount (including chariot crew and beasts)?
author: Andreas Schmidt
content: No. A spell or ability that specifies the caster gaining an effect will only affect the wizard itself and not their mount.

question: When do you chose the lore for a Wizarding Hat and Arcane Familiar? And when do you chose how many spells from which lore are rolled for?
author: Andreas Schmidt
content: In both cases, the magic lore has to be noted in the army list. You can roll spells and do the dice allocation for the number of spells before deployment in the order you chose for all your wizards.

question: Does the \"Unity and Harmony\" rule affect Cathay units joined by Mercenary characters?
author: Andreas Schmidt
content: No, Jade Warriors & Jade Lancers may only reroll To-Hit rolls of 1 if they are within 3 inches of a mercenary unit. Mercenary characters joined to non-mercenary units do not count.

question: Can a unit that was drawn from another army list benefit from special rules that mention \"friendly <faction> units\", for example, a Chaos Spawn in a Beastmen Brayherd Army benefit from a Herdstone?
author: Andreas Schmidt
content: Yes, as it has been picked as part of a Beastmen Brayherds army, although it originates from the Warriors of Chaos rules. This applies for all similar unit entries, which are taken as part of the army list (not as mercenaries or allies except for allied armies of infamies in their corresponding grand army).

question: Can you see \"into\" a base of a model or does the base itself block Line of Sight of that Model? Can you aim cannon shots onto the base of a model you see?
author: Andreas Schmidt
content: No, bases fully block line of sight.

question: Ogdruz Swampcalla and Branchwraith are now the only non‑updated Wizards with the wording \"knows spells from the following Lores of Magic” (multiples) instead of “uses spells from … OR …”— does that wording difference create an actual rules distinction?
author: Andreas Schmidt
referenced_rules:
GW FAQ
Lores of Magic CRB 106
content: Yes. GW did issue an errata to the other wizards and did not issue an errata to these two. It was not a generalized FAQ, so the wordign remains. Therefore, the exceptions may have access to multiple Lores at the same time.

question: What happens when you use Redress the Ranks (or uses Drilled) with a unit that contains a character or a command group?
author: Andreas Schmidt
content: When a unit performs Redress the Ranks, Models can be either removed from the front rank or added to the front rank, divided as equally as possible on either sides of the unit to maintain its centre. When removing models, the last models to remove must be the characters, then the command group, always keeping the standard bearer in the front rank and as close to the centre as possible. Command group models removed from the front rank must go to the second rank (and third in case of a single column). Characters removed from the front rank must go to the rear rank. The player choses the position of all models in their respective back ranks. When adding models to the front rank, the opposite order must be followed: first the command group, then the characters, before rank and file models. The position of added models can be chosen by the controlling player, but must respect the positioning rule for the command group and for characters: standard bearer as close to the centre as possible, command group models to either side, characters anywhere in the front rank. Note that characters may be placed among the command group.

question: How does character placement in a unit affect the unit's command models?
author: Andreas Schmidt
content: Per GW FAQ, characters can be placed among a unit's command. However, a standard bearer must be placed in the center of the front rank (or as close as possible) and command models must be placed in the front rank. Characters cannot displace command models from the front rank or the standard bearer from the center of the unit, but may displace a champion or musician to another position within the front rank. Rank & file models cannot be placed between command models (including characters) and the standard bearer.

question: Is a unit with Random Movement affected by modifiers applying to their Movement characteristic, such as terrain or spells?
author: Andreas Schmidt
content: Yes. Although models with the Random Movement special rule "do not have a normal Movement characteristic", the result of their dice roll is taken as their Movement characteristic and is affected by modifiers.

question: The spell Hidden Pathways allows the target to \"perform a Quick Turn, even if it would not normally be able to do so.\" What exactly does this mean?
author: Andreas Schmidt
content: The unit gains Quick Turn and can use it even after marching or if it is not in Open Order formation

question: If a character is placed in the rear rank of a unit because there is no space for them in the front rank due to the presence of command models and/or other characters, is that character considered to have retired? Can they cast spells or provide benefits to their unit?
author: Andreas Schmidt
content: A character that is placed in the rear rank for this reason has not retired. They provide bonuses to the unit they have joined and can cast spells without restriction, though they must still be in the fighting rank to cast assailment spells. A character in the rear rank can see through other models in its own unit, and as such may cast Magic Missile spells, perform shooting attacks, or take any other actions that require Line of Sight. In combat, the character may Move Through the Ranks to join the fighting rank as normal.

question: Can you choose when to use the Opal Amulet or are you forced to use it against the first wound?
author: Andreas Schmidt
referenced_rules:
High Elves
Single Use Magic Items CRB 337
content: The item gives the bearer a ward save when used, but the player chooses when to activate single use items. Therefore, the Amulet does not have to be used exclusively against the first wound.

question: When a character leaves a unit, how is that character affected by any spells or effects that modify the unit's movement? Do they maintain the unit formation they were in, or always move as a skirmisher?
author: Andreas Schmidt
content: Movement is checked when a character or unit begins their movement. They move as a skirmisher, and move through other models in their unit freely. Any spells or effects (positive or negative) affect the character's movement during the Remaining Moves phase in which the character leaves the unit. This means that if the unit is affected by Miasmic Mirage, the character cannot march, and if the unit is affected by Steed of Shadows, the character may move using Fly (12). If for any reason the character does not follow the Lone Character rules when not in a unit (such as a character on a light chariot), then they must adhere to the normal movement rules for their respective unit type when leaving the unit.

question: According to GW's FAQ, the Griffon Standard allows its unit to claim a higher rank bonus than normal for its unit type. How exactly does this work?
author: Andreas Schmidt
content: The unit can claim their rank bonus up to the normal maximum for their unit type, but gets +2 instead of +1 for each of these ranks. Infantry with horde have a max of +6 (normally +3), whereas cavalry have a max of +2 (normally +1).

question: Can evasive be used against ranged attacks with the Column of Fire rule (such as the Dwarf flame cannon)?
author: Andreas Schmidt
content: Column of Fire's "intended target" does not need to be a unit, but can instead be a point on the table (similar to the Cannon Fire) rule. Because the unit is not targeted specifically, they cannot use Evasive.

question: When do you determine the arc for a detachment supporting charge?
turn_order: 2-1 Movement Phase Declare Charges and Charge Reaction
author: Andreas Schmidt
content: Similar to Counter-Charge FAQ - determine the arc after the main charge has occurred, out of sequence as this is a reaction as the charge is resolved after the primary charge.

question: If a regular or heavy infantry unit, that is not in skirmish formation, is charged in the flank or rear, do they get to use the press of battle special rule for these arcs/fighting ranks?
turn_order: 4-1 Combat Phase Choose Combat & Determine Who Can Fight
author: Andreas Schmidt
content: Yes

question: Can the Battle Standard be \"claimed as a trophy\" in the same way as any other standard (as described p.200), by killing the BSB in combat or running him down?
author: Andreas Schmidt
referenced_rules:
Trophies of War CRB 286
Standards CRB 152
content: Yes, and the Victory Points obtained are cumulative to the Victory Points granted for slaying the BSB.

question: How many spells does a Cathay L4 wizard equipped with the Scrolls of Wei-jin and the Learned Feng Shi Bo know?
author: Andreas Schmidt
content: 5 Spells

question: If a bray-shaman in a Wild Herd army chooses to not use the +1 to cast or dispel from Dark Coven on a spell that they miscast, do friendly wizards within their command range still suffer the effect of that miscast?
author: Andreas Schmidt
content: No. The miscast is shared with friendly wizards only when a bray-shaman chooses to use the +1 from Dark Coven before rolling to cast or dispel.

question: Can you use stand and shoot against a lone character, that would otherwise be protected by the \"lone character\" rule?
turn_order: 2-1 Movement Phase Declare Charges and Charge Reaction
author: Andreas Schmidt
content: Yes, Stand and Shoot does not include targeting

question: How do I determine the troop type of a unit that includes rank-and-file models with two different troop types?
author: Andreas Schmidt
content: Use the unit type stated in the primary Unit entry (War Beasts / Cavalry for Primal Warhounds for example). However, Rank Bonus and Special Rules that affect models can be applied to individual models (using generals Ld, getting a third rank bonus with horde if the rank consists entirely of Infantry etc).

question: What happens when a unit flees off the  board with a flee reaction? How is that unit charged and is the charging unit allowed to leave the board?
author: Andreas Schmidt
content: Conduct the Flee move off the board. Leave the unit in place as close as possible to the position it would end the move - as the table allows. Conduct the charge move to the fleeing unit adhering to all charge move criteria, without the need to maximize. If the charging unit would leave the board, it is allowed to do so, as if it had conducted a pursuit off the Board. If it doesn’t catch the fleeing unit, it is Not allowed to attempt to Reform, even that the fleeing unit counts as destroyed. Note that the unit is not allowed to move in the following compulsory move phase since it already has moved in the charge move phase and will re-enter the board in it's next compulsory move phase.
